original: thog mar dgos pa brjod par bya //
analyzed: thog mar dgos pa brjod par bya //
translated: First, the purpose is stated.

original: de 'grub de yi bsdus don las //
analyzed: de 'grub de yi bsdus don las //
translated: From the summary of the treatise, its accomplishment is known.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni tshig don las //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni tshig don las //
translated: The summary of the treatise is from the meaning of the words.

original: go rims rigs pa snga phyi dag / mi 'gal ba ni gnyis las so //
analyzed: go rims rigs pa snga phyi dag / mi 'gal ba ni gnyis las so //
translated: The sequence and reasoning are from the two, the non-contradiction of earlier and later.

original: gzhan yang dgos pa brjod pa las ni mdo sde'i 'bras bu phun sum sogs pa shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgos pa brjod pa las ni mdo sde'i 'bras bu phun sum sogs pa shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, from the statement of the purpose, the complete result of the sutra is known.

original: bsdus pa'i don brjod pa las ni don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don brjod pa las ni don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: From the statement of the summary meaning, it is understood that it is done in terms of the meaning.

original: tshig gi don brjod pa las ni bsdus pa'i don dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / dgongs pa'i mtshan yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi don brjod pa las ni bsdus pa'i don dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / dgongs pa'i mtshan yin la /
translated: From the statement of the meaning of the words, the summary meaning, the characteristics of phenomena, and the intention are known.

original: mtshams sbyar ba brjod pa @31a * //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba brjod pa @31a * //
translated: From the statement of the connection,

original: las ni tshig rnams kyi go rims 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: las ni tshig rnams kyi go rims 'brel pa'o //
translated: the sequence of the words is connected.

original: brgal ba dang lan brjod pa las ni rigs pa dang snga phyi mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: brgal ba dang lan brjod pa las ni rigs pa dang snga phyi mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: From the statement of objections and replies, the reasoning and non-contradiction of earlier and later are known.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lnga po bstan pa byas pa las //
analyzed: lnga po bstan pa byas pa las //
translated: From the teaching of the five,

original: 'bras bu phun sum dbang byas dang // de bzhin bsdus don la sogs gsum //
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum dbang byas dang // de bzhin bsdus don la sogs gsum //
translated: the result, the complete, and the powerful, and likewise the three such as the summary meaning,

original: 'brel dang mi 'gal shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel dang mi 'gal shes par 'gyur //
translated: One understands the connection and the non-contradiction.

original: de la chos kyi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar gzugs ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar gzugs ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The characteristic of a dharma is like the statement, ‚ÄúForm is impermanent.‚Äù

original: tshig 'dis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pa na dgos pa'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshig 'dis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pa na dgos pa'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: When the meaning of the general and specific characteristics is taught by this statement, the characteristic of the purpose is like the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the suffering of conditioned states and the meaning of the suffering of contaminated states are intended.

original: de bzhin du rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pags pa nas rkang gi bar du 'chad do zhes bya ba lta bu ni 'dir dbang po lnga po dag tu dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pags pa nas rkang gi bar du 'chad do zhes bya ba lta bu ni 'dir dbang po lnga po dag tu dgongs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the statement, ‚ÄúGain and honor are skin,‚Äù is intended to refer to the five faculties,

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni pags pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'og ma 'og ma nang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / gces rim yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni pags pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'og ma 'og ma nang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / gces rim yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because faith and so on are like skin and so forth, because they are the inner core of the latter, and because they are the most precious.üîΩAlso, the scriptures state:

original: lung las kyang dad pa tsam ni pags pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: lung las kyang dad pa tsam ni pags pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Faith alone is like skin,

original: srab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is thin.

original: brtson 'grus ni sha lta bu yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni sha lta bu yin te /
translated: Effort is like flesh,

original: rtag tu rtsom pas sdug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rtsom pas sdug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the other perfections.

original: dran pa ni rgyus pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni rgyus pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Recollection is like sinews,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i don 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i don 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds the other perfections together.

original: ting de 'dzin ni rus pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ting de 'dzin ni rus pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Samadhi is like bones,

original: rtog pa ngan pas phyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pas phyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the other perfections.

original: shes rab ni rkang lta bu yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni rkang lta bu yin te /
translated: Wisdom is like feet,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is the basis of the other perfections.

original: de la mdo sde'i dgos pa ni bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mdo sde'i dgos pa ni bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The purpose of the sutras is to be known in brief as fourfold:

original: kun tu rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par bstan pa dang / bag med pa rnams la yang dag par len du gzhug pa dang / kun tu zhum pa rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par bstan pa dang / bag med pa rnams la yang dag par len du gzhug pa dang / kun tu zhum pa rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par dga' bar bya ste /
translated: for the confused, correct teaching; for the heedless, correct instigation; for the fainthearted, correct encouragement; and for those who have correctly set out, correct gladdening.

original: ji ltar rigs par kha cig tu ni gcig yin pa nas kha cig tu ni bzhi yin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par kha cig tu ni gcig yin pa nas kha cig tu ni bzhi yin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In some cases, one is appropriate, up to four in some cases.

original: de'i phyir de dang de las yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang de las yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: Therefore, he teaches them correctly in this and that way.

original: yang dag par len du 'jug par mdzad /üîΩyang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par len du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: He causes them to take up correctly.üîΩHe causes them to be elated correctly.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: He causes them to rejoice correctly.

original: gang zag kha cig gcig pu yin yang don kha cig la kun @31b tu rmongs la /
analyzed: gang zag kha cig gcig pu yin yang don kha cig la kun @31b tu rmongs la /
translated: Some persons, although they are alone, are confused about some things,

original: kha cig la zhes bya ba nas yang dag par zhugs pa'i bar du yin pas gcig la yang bzhi 'thad do //
analyzed: kha cig la zhes bya ba nas yang dag par zhugs pa'i bar du yin pas gcig la yang bzhi 'thad do //
translated: up to some are correctly engaged. Therefore, four are appropriate for one.

original: de la kun tu rmongs pa rnams ni mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun tu rmongs pa rnams ni mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, those who are confused possess ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge.

original: bag med pa rnams ni le lo dang 'dun pa med pa dang g-yon sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag med pa rnams ni le lo dang 'dun pa med pa dang g-yon sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are heedless possess laziness, lack of aspiration, and crookedness.

original: kun tu zhum pa rnams ni dman pa la mos pa dang bdag nyid mi nus par sems pa dang 'gyod pa dang bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu zhum pa rnams ni dman pa la mos pa dang bdag nyid mi nus par sems pa dang 'gyod pa dang bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are completely discouraged are those who are devoted to the inferior, who think themselves incapable, who are regretful, and who are fearful of having many things to do.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams ni phyin ci ma log pa dang mnyam pa dang chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams ni phyin ci ma log pa dang mnyam pa dang chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are correctly engaged are those who are endowed with the practice of correct, equal, and insatiable effort.

original: nag po'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa yang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa yang dgos pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of turning away from the dark side is also a purpose.

original: yang na de yang yang dag bar lan du 'jug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na de yang yang dag bar lan du 'jug pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or, that is also a correct response,

original: de bzlog pa la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzlog pa la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the purpose of engaging in turning away from that.

original: yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa de dag kyang yon tan gyi khyad par gyi don nam /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa de dag kyang yon tan gyi khyad par gyi don nam /
translated: Those correct teachings, etc. are also for the purpose of special qualities,

original: yongs su spong bar byed pa'i don nam /
analyzed: yongs su spong bar byed pa'i don nam /
translated: for the purpose of complete abandonment,

original: rten par byed pa'i don nam /
analyzed: rten par byed pa'i don nam /
translated: for the purpose of support,

original: skyo ba'i don nam /
analyzed: skyo ba'i don nam /
translated: for the purpose of weariness,

original: dad pa'i don nam /
analyzed: dad pa'i don nam /
translated: for the purpose of faith,üîΩand for the purpose of the result.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa yin par ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa yin par ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: Such purposes should be understood as appropriate.

original: mdo las ma dad pa gnyis ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par len du 'jug /'dul bar byed /
analyzed: mdo las ma dad pa gnyis ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par len du 'jug /'dul bar byed /
translated: The sutras state:üîΩThe two types of faith cause one to take up, to be tamed,

original: 'dzud par byed /üîΩrab tu 'jog par byed ces 'byung ba gang yin pa de ci don gcig pa zhig yin nam 'on te don tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: 'dzud par byed / rab tu 'jog par byed ces 'byung ba gang yin pa de ci don gcig pa zhig yin nam 'on te don tha dad pa yin /
translated: to enter, and to be established in perfect faith.üîΩAre these synonyms or do they have different meanings?

original: de las cir 'gyur gal te don gcig pa zhig yin na ni don zlos pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur gal te don gcig pa zhig yin na ni don zlos pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the problem? If they have the same meaning, the problem is that the meaning is repeated.

original: 'on te don tha dad pa zhig yin na ni ji ltar na yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa kho na mdo sde'i dgos pa dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don tha dad pa zhig yin na ni ji ltar na yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa kho na mdo sde'i dgos pa dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they have different meanings, how could teaching and so on be the purpose of the sutras?

original: re zhig don gcig pa zhig yin te mdo don zlos na skyon cir 'gyur /
analyzed: re zhig don gcig pa zhig yin te mdo don zlos na skyon cir 'gyur /
translated: They have the same meaning. If the meaning of the sutras is repeated, what is the problem?

original: de ni don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni don med par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be meaningless.

original: tshig 'jug pa don med pa yin na ni ci'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshig 'jug pa don med pa yin na ni ci'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur la /
translated: If the words are meaningless, why are they repeated?

original: ci'i phyir rnam grangs rnams kyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam grangs rnams kyis bstan gyi /
translated: Why are they taught by synonyms?

original: de nyid kyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not just by that?

original: gal te sangs rgyas rnams kyis rnam grangs gsungs pa dgos pa med pa zhig yin na ni skyon der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas rnams kyis rnam grangs gsungs pa dgos pa med pa zhig yin na ni skyon der 'gyur ro //
translated: If the buddhas‚Äô statements of synonyms were purposeless, then that would be a fault.

original: 'dir dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose here?

original: dgos pa dag ni brgyad de rnam grangs gsungs pa ni 'dul ba tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa dag ni brgyad de rnam grangs gsungs pa ni 'dul ba tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: There are eight purposes: The statement of synonyms is for the sake of different disciples,

original: de'i tshe dang phyi ma'i tshe kha cig la la las khong du chud @32a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe dang phyi ma'i tshe kha cig la la las khong du chud @32a * //
translated: because at that time and later, some understand through one and some through another.üîΩAnd for the sake of those distracted at that time, because others would criticize that statement, the meaning of that should be taught through synonyms.

original: par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la brjod pa de nyid kyi ni gzhan dag gis smad par 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyis de'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / yid mi gzhungs pa rnams la yang dang yang du de'i don yang dag par mtshon pas mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la brjod pa de nyid kyi ni gzhan dag gis smad par 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyis de'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / yid mi gzhungs pa rnams la yang dang yang du de'i don yang dag par mtshon pas mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: And for the sake of those with poor memory, because the meaning of that is repeatedly indicated, it should be made unforgettable.

original: tshig gcig la don du ma byung bas don gzhan du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du ming de rnams kyis de'i don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir sgra nges par sbyor ba lta bu dang / chos sgrogs pa rnams don gyi bshad sbyar dang go bar byed pa gnyis la thabs mkhas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: tshig gcig la don du ma byung bas don gzhan du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du ming de rnams kyis de'i don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir sgra nges par sbyor ba lta bu dang / chos sgrogs pa rnams don gyi bshad sbyar dang go bar byed pa gnyis la thabs mkhas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because a single word has many meanings, the term is repeated in order to eliminate the conception of another meaning, like the application of a term to a specific object, and in order to establish the correct meaning of those terms elsewhere, and

original: nyid la chos so sor yang dag par rig pa mnga' bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la de'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyid la chos so sor yang dag par rig pa mnga' bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la de'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: in order to demonstrate one's own perfect knowledge of the Dharma and to generate the seed of that knowledge in others.

original: rnam par bshad pa byed pa thams cad kyang rnam grangs bshad pa dag gis slob ma rnams la go bar byed pas na de lta bu'i rang bzhin can la zlos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa byed pa thams cad kyang rnam grangs bshad pa dag gis slob ma rnams la go bar byed pas na de lta bu'i rang bzhin can la zlos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all expositors of the Dharma make their students understand by means of explanations of synonyms, there is no fault of repetition in such a nature.

original: yang na don tha dad pa yin du chug ste /üîΩ'di ltar byos shig ces bya ba ni yang dag bar len du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don tha dad pa yin du chug ste /üîΩ'di ltar byos shig ces bya ba ni yang dag bar len du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Or, even if the meanings are different,üîΩthe term is repeated in order to establish the meaning, like the application of a term to a specific object, and in order to establish the correct meaning of those terms elsewhere, andüîΩin order to demonstrate one's own perfect knowledge of the Dharma and to generate the seed of that knowledge in others.üîΩSince all expositors of the Dharma make their students understand by means of explanations of synonyms, there is no fault of repetition in such a nature.

original: 'dul bar byed pa ni gus par byed pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul bar byed pa ni gus par byed pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the one that tames, because it is the means of accomplishing respect.üîΩ

original: 'dzud par byed pa ni sgrub pa la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzud par byed pa ni sgrub pa la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the one that causes to enter because it causes to be established in practice.

original: rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis rnam par mi g-yo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis rnam par mi g-yo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the one that causes to be situated because it causes to be situated in the state of non-regression through the state of non-confusion.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dul bar byed pa ni bgegs sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dul bar byed pa ni bgegs sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Another explanation: It is the one that causes to be disciplined because it removes obstacles.

original: ji ltar na mdo sde las dgos pa mang po mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mdo sde las dgos pa mang po mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: How is it that the S≈´tra does not mention the many aims?

original: mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung ste /
translated: It does not mention them,

original: 'dul bar byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni nye bar 'dun par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul bar byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni nye bar 'dun par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of the one that causes to be disciplined, etc. is the one that causes to aspire.üîΩBut the one that causes to aspire is mentioned by way of synonyms,

original: 'o na rnam grangs kyis nye bar 'dun par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na rnam grangs kyis nye bar 'dun par byed pa'am /
translated: or else it is mentioned by way of the reversal of aspiration,

original: 'dun par zlog par byed pa 'di lta ste /üîΩsbyor bar bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: 'dun par zlog par byed pa 'di lta ste / sbyor bar bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: as in the following passage:üîΩIt is proper to apply oneself.

original: bag yod par bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: bag yod par bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: It is proper to be heedful.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa la rnal 'byor du bya ba ni rigs so zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' bo dge slong 'du 'dzi la kun dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la kun dga' ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson zhing gnas pa ni legs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa la rnal 'byor du bya ba ni rigs so zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' bo dge slong 'du 'dzi la kun dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la kun dga' ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson zhing gnas pa ni legs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement: Ananda, it is not good for a monk to delight in, to enjoy, to delight in the practice of, and to abide in, society?

original: de dag kyang 'dul ba @32b bag med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang du mdzad nas ni yang dag par len du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dul ba @32b bag med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang du mdzad nas ni yang dag par len du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha, in consideration of those who are by nature heedless, encourages them to take up the practice of yoga.

original: kun tu rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ni yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ni yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: In consideration of those who are confused, he teaches them.

original: rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid gnyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid gnyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For he teaches both the rational and the irrational.

original: de la mdo sde'i dum bu dang po 'di ni gang la brten nas gang bya ba de la nye bar 'dun par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde'i dum bu dang po 'di ni gang la brten nas gang bya ba de la nye bar 'dun par byed pa yin te /
translated: The first section of the sutra encourages one to be intent upon what is to be done in dependence upon what.

original: ci la brten nas she na /
analyzed: ci la brten nas she na /
translated: In dependence upon what?

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la'o //
translated: in the undertaking of vigor.

original: ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be done?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po'i phyogs bsten par bya'o //

analyzed: rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba lam rig pa gang zhe na /

original: ji lta bur srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnams kyis mdor kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum po nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams bstan pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du ma dad pa ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par len du 'jug pa nas /

original: shes rab 'chal ba ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i bar tshig 'di rnams kyis ni mdor na 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyu yang dag par len du 'jug pa yongs su bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar dad pas tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug la /

original: ji ltar dge slong ma'i don mdo sde las kun dga' bo yid phyi rol du bzhag nas yid phyi rol du bzhag go snyam pa dang / de'i 'og tu snga ma bzhin du mngon par bsdus nas bdag gi yid phyi rol du bzhag cing rnam par grol lo snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //

original: ro myong bar byed pa ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ro myong bar byed pa ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Experiencing is the nature.

original: de yang sred pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sred pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that should be known as craving.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: In terms of the divisions of states, there are six types:

original: kun tu spyod pa dang / dang du len pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / yon tan du blta ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ma spangs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa dang / dang du len pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / yon tan du blta ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ma spangs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: the state of complete engagement, the state of acceptance, the state of subjugation, the state of viewing as a good quality, the state of manifestation, and the state of non-abandonment.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus mthong ba'i chos nyid la sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum @46b bu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus mthong ba'i chos nyid la sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum @46b bu'o //
translated: The sutra passage is: ‚ÄúBecause of taking up unwholesome dharmas, one dwells in suffering in this very life.‚Äù

original: de la sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang bcas pa ni yongs su tshol ba'i tshe grang ba na lhags pas sbrebs pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang bcas pa ni yongs su tshol ba'i tshe grang ba na lhags pas sbrebs pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúwith suffering‚Äù is when one is tormented by cold wind while seeking.

original: phongs pa dang bcas pas ni 'dod pas phongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'byor pa med pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: phongs pa dang bcas pas ni 'dod pas phongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'byor pa med pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith want‚Äù is when one is not prosperous, because one is endowed with the want of desire.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa ni rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir kun tu srung ba'i tshe dbyug pa dang mtshon cha'i gnod pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa ni rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir kun tu srung ba'i tshe dbyug pa dang mtshon cha'i gnod pa la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWith harm‚Äù is when one is endowed with the harm of kings, thieves, and so on, because one is protected by the harm of clubs and weapons and so on.

original: yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa ni mya ngan dang / mi tshim pa dang yid la gcags pa'i yongs su gdung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa ni mya ngan dang / mi tshim pa dang yid la gcags pa'i yongs su gdung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is tormented because he is tormented by grief, dissatisfaction, and regret.

original: rgud pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / 'chi ba'i dus dag tu ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rgud pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / 'chi ba'i dus dag tu ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: He is tormented at the time of misfortune, at the time of enjoyment, and at the time of death, respectively.

original: srog gcod pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: By frequently cultivating and repeatedly practicing the taking of life is a summary verse of the sutra.

original: de la kun tu bsten cing zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid du ston la /
analyzed: de la kun tu bsten cing zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid du ston la /
translated: There, frequently cultivating shows that it is done,

original: bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni bsags pa nyid de brtson pa dang / phyir zhing byed pa gnyis bsam pa dang sbyor bas de brtas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni bsags pa nyid de brtson pa dang / phyir zhing byed pa gnyis bsam pa dang sbyor bas de brtas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and repeatedly practicing shows that it is accumulated, because it is done with effort and done again and again in order to increase it.

original: 'di la bsgom pa byas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la bsgom pa byas pa'am /
translated: Here, cultivation is either the arising of cultivation,üîΩor cultivation is that which is cultivated, because of the verbal root

original: bsgom pa byung bas sam nges pa'i tshig gis na bsgoms par gyur pas na bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa byung bas sam nges pa'i tshig gis na bsgoms par gyur pas na bsgom pa ste /
translated: meaning to be cultivated.

original: bsam pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: bsam pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is done with a certain intention,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: sdig pa byas par gyur na yang //
analyzed: sdig pa byas par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if you have committed a sin,

original: de la yang dang yang mi bya //
analyzed: de la yang dang yang mi bya //
translated: do not do it again and again.

original: sdig pa kun bsags sdug bsngal bas //
analyzed: sdig pa kun bsags sdug bsngal bas //
translated: The accumulation of all sins is suffering;

original: 'di la 'dun pa mi bya'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'dun pa mi bya'o // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: do not aspire to it.

original: 'dir 'dun pas ni brtson pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dir 'dun pas ni brtson pa ston to //
translated: Here, aspiration shows effort.

original: yang dang yang du byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pas ni bsags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pas ni bsags pa yin te /
translated: By doing it again and again and by aspiring to it, it is accumulated.

original: kun du bsags pa'i rnam grangs kyis yin no //
analyzed: kun du bsags pa'i rnam grangs kyis yin no //
translated: It is an accumulation by the category of complete accumulation.

original: bsags pa'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsags pa'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Any action that is accumulated will certainly have a ripened effect.

original: kha cig la ni byas par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig la ni byas par yang 'gyur te /
translated: But for some, it is only done.

original: skal pa chung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skal pa chung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because of their small fortune,

original: zhing dang sems pa'i khyad par las so //
analyzed: zhing dang sems pa'i khyad par las so //
translated: or because of the distinction of the field and intention.

original: gal te kun tu bsten pa la sogs pas byas pa dang bsags pa nyid du ston na /
analyzed: gal te kun tu bsten pa la sogs pas byas pa dang bsags pa nyid du ston na /
translated: If it is shown that it is done and accumulated by repeated practice, etc.,

original: mi sdug pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas ni 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: mi sdug pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pas ni 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: how can it be right to say that the result of repeated practice, development, and cultivation of the unwholesome is great?

original: de la yang brtson pa dang / lan mang du bya ba bya @47a * //
analyzed: de la yang brtson pa dang / lan mang du bya ba bya @47a * //
translated: And it is necessary to apply oneself to that and to do it many times.

original: dgos so // 'di ltar yang yin te /
analyzed: dgos so // 'di ltar yang yin te /
translated: It is also like this:

original: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba dang ldan par yang ston to //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba dang ldan par yang ston to //
translated: It is also taught as having arising, abiding, and increasing.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba dang / rnyed pa dang / 'grub pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba dang / rnyed pa dang / 'grub pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Moreover, it is the stage of application, attainment, and accomplishment.

original: gzhan yang stobs dang skabs dang bcas pa dang / skabs med pa 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang stobs dang skabs dang bcas pa dang / skabs med pa 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Moreover, it is the stage of mental attention that occurs with and without opportunity,

original: ting nge 'dzin la ma thob pa dang / thob pa dang / goms pa na'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la ma thob pa dang / thob pa dang / goms pa na'o //
translated: in the context of not yet attaining, attaining, and cultivating concentration.

original: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnas skabs yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the stage of the three types of spiritual practitioners.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni las dang po pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni las dang po pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: The three types of spiritual practitioners are the beginner, the one who has completed training, and the one who has gone beyond mental attention.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir dang / sems la de'i sa bon brtas par byed pa'i phyir dang / brtas pa de phyir zhing mngon du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu bsten pa la sogs pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir dang / sems la de'i sa bon brtas par byed pa'i phyir dang / brtas pa de phyir zhing mngon du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu bsten pa la sogs pa gsum yin no //
translated: There is another explanation: the three, i.e., repeated practice, etc., are, respectively, the cause of the production of the first direct realization, the cause of the increase of the seed of that in the mental series, and the cause of the actualization of that increase.

original: brjod par bya ba rnam pa du ma yin kyang rjod pa ni gcig yin no zhes bya ba de ni bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rnam pa du ma yin kyang rjod pa ni gcig yin no zhes bya ba de ni bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Although the objects of expression are many, the expression is one. This has been established.

original: sgrib pa lnga po zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The five hindrances is a passage from a Sutra.

original: de la lnga kho na'i dgos pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de la lnga kho na'i dgos pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Of these, the two hindrances to the application to concentration are the first two.

original: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa'i sgrib pa ni gsum yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa'i sgrib pa ni gsum yin te /
translated: The three hindrances to the entry into concentration are

original: sems nang du sdud pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par sbyor ba la nges pa ni mi rnyed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nang du sdud pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par sbyor ba la nges pa ni mi rnyed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the withdrawal of the mind inward, because of distraction outward, and because of the non-acquisition of certainty in the correct application.

original: gzhan yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gnyis yin la /
translated: Moreover, the two obscurations are the obscurations to the applications of serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas la zhugs pa'i ni zhum pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa ni gcig yin zhing /
analyzed: zhi gnas la zhugs pa'i ni zhum pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa ni gcig yin zhing /
translated: When one is engaged in serenity, there is only one obscuration to serenity, because the fault of laxity is present.

original: lhag mthong la zhugs pa yin na ni rnam par ma zhi ba dang / ma nges pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir lhag mthong gi sgrib pa ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lhag mthong la zhugs pa yin na ni rnam par ma zhi ba dang / ma nges pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir lhag mthong gi sgrib pa ni gnyis so //
translated: When one is engaged in insight, there are two obscurations to insight, because the faults of non-tranquility and non-determination are present.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi sgrib pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi sgrib pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two obscurations to morality,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis kyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis kyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because immorality is motivated by both attachment and aversion.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgrib pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgrib pa yang gnyis te /
translated: There are also two obscurations to concentration,

original: sems nang du sdud pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nang du sdud pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is either withdrawn inward or distracted outward.

original: shes rab kyi sgrib pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgrib pa ni gcig ste /
translated: There is only one obscuration to wisdom,

original: yang dag par nges pa mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par nges pa mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not attain true determination.

original: lung las tshul khrims kyi sgrib pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: lung las tshul khrims kyi sgrib pa ni gcig ste /
translated: There is one obscuration to morality,

original: @47b tshangs par spyod pa las nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @47b tshangs par spyod pa las nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to fall from pure action.

original: gdams ngag gi sgrib pa yang gcig ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag gi sgrib pa yang gcig ste /
translated: There is one obscuration to instruction,

original: des tshig mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des tshig mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to be intolerant of the words.

original: zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi dus dag tu ste 'grub pa'i sgrib pa gsum mo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi dus dag tu ste 'grub pa'i sgrib pa gsum mo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There are three obscurations to the times of serenity, complete acceptance, and equanimity.

original: sgyu rtsal shes dag gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba dag ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal shes dag gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba dag ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: These three are the bases and sources of the arts of sentient beings.

original: de la las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba dag ces bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa dang / rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de la las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba dag ces bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa dang / rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu ston pa yin te /
translated: The bases and sources of action are the causes of engagement and the causes of continuation.

original: chags pa la sogs pa gang dang du len pa na nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / gang gis mi 'dzem pa na nyes par spyod pa las mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa gang dang du len pa na nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / gang gis mi 'dzem pa na nyes par spyod pa las mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: When one indulges in attachment, etc., one instigates the performance of misdeeds; when one does not shun them, one does not turn away from misdeeds.

original: de ltar na de byas pa dang bsags pa'i yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de byas pa dang bsags pa'i yin no //
translated: Thus, one is the instigator and the other is the accumulator.

original: gzhan yang chags pa la sogs pa ni kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang chags pa la sogs pa ni kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin par ston to //
translated: Moreover, attachment, etc., are taught to be the states of complete engagement and the states of domination.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chags pa dang chags pas zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chags pa dang chags pas zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that attachment and the domination of attachment exist.

original: zil gyis ma non na ni des de las skyes pa'i las slong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: zil gyis ma non na ni des de las skyes pa'i las slong bar mi byed do //
translated: If one is not dominated by attachment, it does not instigate the performance of action that arises from it.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs kyang yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are the states of preparation and the states of conclusion.

original: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the state of preparation of mental misdeeds?

original: chags pa la sogs pa gang gis gzhan gyi rdzas bdag gir bya ba la sogs pa phyis nges pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa gang gis gzhan gyi rdzas bdag gir bya ba la sogs pa phyis nges pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: One becomes certain later on that one will appropriate the goods of others through attachment and so on.

original: gzhan yang chags pa la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid la byed pa dang smra ba dang rtog pa'i gzhi sems kyi kun 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: gzhan yang chags pa la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid la byed pa dang smra ba dang rtog pa'i gzhi sems kyi kun 'byung ba dag go //
translated: Moreover, attachment and so on are the origin of the mind, the basis of the activities of body, speech, and mind, and the basis of speech and thought.

original: de lta na ni dkar po'i phyogs la yang kun 'byung ba smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dkar po'i phyogs la yang kun 'byung ba smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the origin of virtue would also have to be mentioned.

original: rnam grangs dang po dag tu ni gzhi zad pa zhes 'byung ba nyid kyis kun 'byung ba zad pa yang rab tu grub pa'i phyir na mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang po dag tu ni gzhi zad pa zhes 'byung ba nyid kyis kun 'byung ba zad pa yang rab tu grub pa'i phyir na mi 'gyur la /
translated: In the first set of synonyms, the origin of the mind is established as the exhaustion of the origin of suffering, since it is said that the basis is exhausted.

original: btsun pa 'od srungs pa'i gzhung las /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srungs pa'i gzhung las /
translated: In the scriptures of Bhadanta KƒÅtyƒÅyanƒ´putra,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúThe three bases are the origin of all action.‚Äù

original: gzhi gsum dag ni las kun 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes 'don pa de dag gi ltar na zlos pa'i skyon yang med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhi gsum dag ni las kun 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes 'don pa de dag gi ltar na zlos pa'i skyon yang med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of repetition in the first set of synonyms.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir las kyi gzhi dang / kun 'byung ba dag ces ci'i phyir mi smos she na /üîΩchags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po @48a * //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir las kyi gzhi dang / kun 'byung ba dag ces ci'i phyir mi smos she na / chags pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po @48a * //
translated: Why are nonattachment, etc. not mentioned as the basis of karma and origination, since they are roots of virtue?

original: nyid du yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyid du yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are taught as the antidotes to attachment, etc.

original: gzhan du na ni de dag gi gnyen po yang dag par ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni de dag gi gnyen po yang dag par ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not taught as antidotes, they would not be taught at all.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa 'di dag ni mi dge ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / don med pa dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa 'di dag ni mi dge ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / don med pa dang ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Thus, these speculations are nonvirtuous, painful, not noble, and meaningless. This is a summary of the sutra.

original: de la mi dge ba rnams ni 'bras bu mi sdug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba rnams ni 'bras bu mi sdug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the nonvirtuous are so called because their fruit is unpleasant.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The painful are so called because they are the cause of suffering in this life.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par byang ba dang 'gal ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par byang ba dang 'gal ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those who are not noble are opposed to purification, since they are subject to the degeneration of wholesome dharmas.

original: don med pa dang ldan pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa dang ldan pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not endowed with the purpose are in accord with the afflictions.

original: mi dag gi 'dod pa rnams ni mi gtsang ba rnams dang / dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / dring ba rnams dang / dri mi mthun pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: mi dag gi 'dod pa rnams ni mi gtsang ba rnams dang / dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / dring ba rnams dang / dri mi mthun pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The desires of men are impure, malodorous, foul, and of discordant smell. This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: de la 'khrig pa'i gzhi'i 'dod pa rnams ni mi gtsang ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'khrig pa'i gzhi'i 'dod pa rnams ni mi gtsang ba rnams te /
translated: Among them, the desires that are the basis of sexual intercourse are impure,

original: lus dri ma can du 'gyur ba nyid kyis bkru dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dri ma can du 'gyur ba nyid kyis bkru dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body becomes soiled and must be washed.

original: dri mi zhim pa rnams ni gcin dang phyi sa 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa rnams ni gcin dang phyi sa 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are malodorous, because urine and excrement flow from them.

original: dri nga ba rnams ni rang bzhin gyi sha dang khrag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri nga ba rnams ni rang bzhin gyi sha dang khrag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are foul, because they are by nature flesh, blood, etc.

original: mi mthun pa rnams ni rdzas re re yang skyug bro ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrig pa bsten pa'i mjug tu mi mthun pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa rnams ni rdzas re re yang skyug bro ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrig pa bsten pa'i mjug tu mi mthun pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because each substance is a basis of disgust, and because a feeling of disgust arises after sexual intercourse.

original: de ltar na tshig gcig dang gcig dang gnyis kyis 'dod pa rnams kyi 'brel ba dang / 'dzag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skyon yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig gcig dang gcig dang gnyis kyis 'dod pa rnams kyi 'brel ba dang / 'dzag pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skyon yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in one verse and two verses, the faults of sensual pleasures are taught in terms of their connection, their dripping, and their intrinsic nature.üîΩHere, it is said:

original: 'dir yang / 'di ltar 'dod pa mi gtsang rnams //
analyzed: 'dir yang / 'di ltar 'dod pa mi gtsang rnams //
translated: In this way, sensual pleasures are impure,üîΩand become foul-smelling, requiring washing,

original: dri mar 'gyur nas bkru bya dang // chu ser gcin rgyags dri mi zhim //
analyzed: dri mar 'gyur nas bkru bya dang // chu ser gcin rgyags dri mi zhim //
translated: and disgusting with pus, urine, and feces.

original: dri nga rnams ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: dri nga rnams ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: They are naturally foul-smelling,

original: mi mthun rnams ni rdzas re yang //üîΩgang phyir de dag smad pa dang // 'khrig pa bsten pa'i mjug tu yang //
analyzed: mi mthun rnams ni rdzas re yang // gang phyir de dag smad pa dang // 'khrig pa bsten pa'i mjug tu yang //
translated: and each substance is disgusting.üîΩBecause they are contemptible,

original: mi mthun pa ni skye phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni skye phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and a feeling of disgust arises after sexual intercourse.

original: gzhan yang mi gtsang ba nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi gtsang ba nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, impurity is twofold:

original: rnag mi gtsang ba nyid dang / nyon mongs pa mi gtsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: rnag mi gtsang ba nyid dang / nyon mongs pa mi gtsang ba nyid de /
translated: The impurity of pus is the impurity of the unclean, and the impurity of the afflictions is the impurity of the unclean.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lus 'di nyid mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna @48b tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna @48b tshogs kyis gang bar so sor rtog go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very body is conceived as filled with various kinds of unclean things.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa mi gtsang ba nyid ni ji skad du /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi gtsang ba nyid ni ji skad du /
translated: The impurity of the afflictions is as it is said:

original: mi gang cung mi gtsang bar byed pa zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi gang cung mi gtsang bar byed pa zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe person who makes something unclean.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rang mi gtsang ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dri mi zhim pa rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang mi gtsang ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dri mi zhim pa rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the impurity of the body, the text says ‚Äúfoul-smelling.‚Äù

original: dri mi zhim pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dri nga ba rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dri nga ba rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the specific characteristic of foul-smelling, the text says ‚Äústench.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The unpleasant is as before.

original: mi gtsang ba ma brjod na ni rnag mi gtsang ba nyid kyis dri mi zhim pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ma brjod na ni rnag mi gtsang ba nyid kyis dri mi zhim pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the unclean were not mentioned, the characteristic of foul-smelling due to the impurity of pus would not be demonstrated.

original: dri mi zhim pa ma brjod na ni dri nga ba smad pa nyid du ma bstan par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa ma brjod na ni dri nga ba smad pa nyid du ma bstan par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the unpleasant smell is not mentioned, then the unpleasant smell is not taught as a fault.

original: lung las ni mi gtsang ba rnams ni bstan pa yin la //
analyzed: lung las ni mi gtsang ba rnams ni bstan pa yin la //
translated: In the scriptures, the impurities are taught.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa yin no //
translated: The rest is explained.

original: de la mdor na 'dod pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis dag ste /
analyzed: de la mdor na 'dod pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis dag ste /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of desires:

original: kha zas kyi 'dod pa rnams dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: kha zas kyi 'dod pa rnams dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: desires for food and desires for sex.

original: ji skad du ral pa can gyi mdo sde las /
analyzed: ji skad du ral pa can gyi mdo sde las /
translated: As it is said in the JƒÅtakamƒÅlƒÅ:

original: zas rnams dang ni skom rnams dang yang de bzhin ro rnams dang // bud med rnams ni 'dod rnams yin zhes 'di na kha cig 'chi //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zas rnams dang ni skom rnams dang yang de bzhin ro rnams dang // bud med rnams ni 'dod rnams yin zhes 'di na kha cig 'chi // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some here say that food, drink, and likewise tastes, and women are desires.

original: de la kha zas kyi 'dod pa rnams ni yongs su 'gyur ba nyid kyis dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / dri nga ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la kha zas kyi 'dod pa rnams ni yongs su 'gyur ba nyid kyis dri mi zhim pa rnams dang / dri nga ba rnams te /
translated: Among them, desires for food are unpleasant smells and bad smells due to transformation.

original: gcin dang phyi sa'i dngos po dang / sha la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcin dang phyi sa'i dngos po dang / sha la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the transformation into the state of urine and excrement, and the state of flesh, etc.

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni yongs su 'gyur ba nyid kyis mi mthun pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni yongs su 'gyur ba nyid kyis mi mthun pa rnams te /
translated: The desires of sex are incompatible because of their very changefulness.

original: yongs su gdung ba dang bral na mi mthun pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang bral na mi mthun pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When one is free from passion, incompatibility arises.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'dod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'dod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The cause of desire and the basis of desire are passages from a Sutra.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the desire of affliction should be understood as twofold:

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags so //
translated: will and passion.

original: gzhi'i 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhi'i 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The desire of the basis is also twofold:

original: thob pa dang / ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa dang / ma thob pa'o //
translated: that which is obtained and that which is not obtained.

original: de la 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'dod pa'i gzhi nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'dod pa'i gzhi nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: Therein, the cause of desire and the basis of desire are for the sake of the two kinds of desire of affliction.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / 'dod pa rnams kho na'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyi don du ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / 'dod pa rnams kho na'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyi don du ste /
translated: The desire of the basis is for the sake of the two kinds of desire of the basis.

original: de ltar na rgyu gang gis gang gi don du rtsod pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu gang gis gang gi don du rtsod pa de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause for which one strives and the purpose for which one strives have been fully explained.

original: chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'chums pa dang / mdud ba bor @49a * //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'chums pa dang / mdud ba bor @49a * //
translated: Attachment,üîΩclinging,üîΩlonging,üîΩand knots.

original: ba dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par zhen par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /üîΩ'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa dang du len pa'i phyir dang / thob pa dang longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs la lan mang du rjes su rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dang / nyes dmigs mi mthong ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ba dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par zhen par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste / 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa dang du len pa'i phyir dang / thob pa dang longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs la lan mang du rjes su rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dang / nyes dmigs mi mthong ba'i phyir dang /
translated: attachment, clinging, fondness, bond, swoon, excessive attachment, and excessive clinging is a summary of the sutra.üîΩBecause of the arising of the entanglement of desire, because of the acceptance of what has arisen, because of the desire for acquisition and enjoyment, because of the frequent subsequent conceptualization of the means to that, and because of not seeing the disadvantages.

original: yongs su bzung ba la kun tu 'dzin pa skye ba'i phyir dang / mi tshim pa nyid kyi rgyus de bsten pa la sems gzhol bas lan mang du gnas pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba la kun tu 'dzin pa skye ba'i phyir dang / mi tshim pa nyid kyi rgyus de bsten pa la sems gzhol bas lan mang du gnas pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the arising of grasping at what is taken up, and because of the frequent abiding in the application to that due to the cause of dissatisfaction, respectively.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
translated: The passage from the sutra that begins with ‚Äúdue to desire, attachment to desire, being bound by desire, being completely bound by desire, and being completely attached to desire‚Äù is a section of the sutra.

original: kun tu spyod pa dang / dang du len pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / des mi 'dzem pa dang / de la kun tu dga' ba nyid dang go rims bzhin no //üîΩgzhan yang rang gi 'dod pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / yongs su bzung ba dang / mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi 'dod pa la mngon par dga' bar byed pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa dang / dang du len pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / des mi 'dzem pa dang / de la kun tu dga' ba nyid dang go rims bzhin no // gzhan yang rang gi 'dod pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / yongs su bzung ba dang / mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi 'dod pa la mngon par dga' bar byed pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags pa gnyis te /
translated: The terms ‚Äúcomplete engagement,‚Äù ‚Äúacceptance,‚Äù ‚Äúoverpowering,‚Äù ‚Äúnot avoiding,‚Äù and ‚Äúcomplete delight‚Äù correspond to the terms ‚Äúdesire,‚Äù ‚Äúattachment to desire,‚Äù ‚Äúbeing bound by desire,‚Äù ‚Äúbeing completely bound by desire,‚Äù and ‚Äúbeing completely attached to desire,‚Äù respectively.üîΩMoreover, there are two other types of desire: (1) delighting in one‚Äôs own desires and (2) delighting in the desires of others.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The terms ‚Äúdesire,‚Äù ‚Äúattachment to desire,‚Äù ‚Äúbeing bound by desire,‚Äù ‚Äúbeing completely bound by desire,‚Äù and ‚Äúbeing completely attached to desire‚Äù correspond to the terms ‚Äúdelighting in one‚Äôs own desires,‚Äù ‚Äúdelighting in the desires of others,‚Äù ‚Äúnot wanting to be separated from what has been obtained,‚Äù ‚Äúwanting to obtain what has not been obtained,‚Äù and ‚Äúcomplete attachment,‚Äù respectively.

original: lta ba rnams la yang lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba rnams la yang lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the views, for there is attachment to views, there is adherence to views, and there is bondage to views.

original: lta ba ni mi mthun pa rnams yin na ni rang gi lta bar mngon par dga' bar byed pas yongs su zhen pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni mi mthun pa rnams yin na ni rang gi lta bar mngon par dga' bar byed pas yongs su zhen pa'o //
translated: When views are in disagreement, there is adherence because of the delight in one's own view.

original: lta ba mthun pa dag yin na ni de'i lta ba la rjes su chags pas kun tu 'dod chags su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba mthun pa dag yin na ni de'i lta ba la rjes su chags pas kun tu 'dod chags su rig par bya'o //
translated: When views are in agreement, there is attachment because of the affection for that view.

original: de lta bu'i tshig rnams ni rnam grangs su gsungs pa yin kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig rnams ni rnam grangs su gsungs pa yin kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: Although these terms are synonyms, there is no fault,

original: dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: because they are used with a specific purpose, as explained above.

original: dge slong dag sems can de dag la ni don spyod pa med /
analyzed: dge slong dag sems can de dag la ni don spyod pa med /
translated: Monks, those beings have no practice of benefit,

original: chos spyod pa med /
analyzed: chos spyod pa med /
translated: no practice of the Dharma,

original: bsod nams spyod pa med /
analyzed: bsod nams spyod pa med /
translated: no practice of merit,

original: dge ba spyod pa med /
analyzed: dge ba spyod pa med /
translated: no practice of virtue,üîΩno practice of what is good and right.

original: dge legs spyod pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: dge legs spyod pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: mdo sde'i don tshol ba dang / nyan @49b pa dang / sems pa dang / rab tu ston pa dag ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don tshol ba dang / nyan @49b pa dang / sems pa dang / rab tu ston pa dag ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: The pursuit of the meaning of the scriptures, listening, reflection, and meditation are the practice of the meaning.

original: chos tshol ba dang nyan pa dang klog pa dang 'don pa dang ston pa ni chos spyod pa'o //üîΩde gnyis ka la brten nas mngon par mtho ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: chos tshol ba dang nyan pa dang klog pa dang 'don pa dang ston pa ni chos spyod pa'o // de gnyis ka la brten nas mngon par mtho ba las brtsams te /
translated: The practice of the Dharma is the pursuit of the Dharma, listening to it, reading it, reciting it, and teaching it.

original: bsod nams kyi las byed pa ni bsod nams spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las byed pa ni bsod nams spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of merit is the performance of meritorious actions based on both of these, beginning with the higher realms.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las byed pa ni dge ba spyod pa ste mi dge ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las byed pa ni dge ba spyod pa ste mi dge ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice of virtue is the performance of immutable actions, because nonvirtue is abandoned.

original: nges par legs pa las brtsams te byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni dge legs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: nges par legs pa las brtsams te byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni dge legs spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice of what is wholesome is the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, beginning with the definite goodness of nirvana,

original: dri ma med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su nyams pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su nyams pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stainless and because it is immutable, since it does not deteriorate.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni bsod nams spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni bsod nams spyod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, generosity is the practice of merit.

original: tshul khrims ni dge ba spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni dge ba spyod pa ste /
translated: Morality is the practice of virtue.

original: bde ba'i don gyis na gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i don gyis na gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is bliss because it does not harm others.

original: sgom pa ni dge legs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni dge legs spyod pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the practice of virtue.

original: dge slong dag de ni chu gter chen po zhes bya ba'i mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ni chu gter chen po zhes bya ba'i mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Monks, this is the section of the sutra called the Great Reservoir.

original: de la snod che ba nyid kyi phyir chu gter chen po'o //
analyzed: de la snod che ba nyid kyi phyir chu gter chen po'o //
translated: It is a great reservoir because it is a great vessel.

original: ye nas chu che ba nyid kyi phyir chu'i chu bo chen po'o //
analyzed: ye nas chu che ba nyid kyi phyir chu'i chu bo chen po'o //
translated: It is a great stream of water because it is a great flow of water from the beginning.

original: chu klung sna tshogs nas glo bur du 'bab pa'i phyir chu'i tshogs chen po'o //
analyzed: chu klung sna tshogs nas glo bur du 'bab pa'i phyir chu'i tshogs chen po'o //
translated: It is a great mass of water because it is a sudden descent of various rivers.

original: skabs par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir chu'i chu chen po ste /
analyzed: skabs par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir chu'i chu chen po ste /
translated: It is a great flood of water because it is uninterrupted.

original: rtag tu chur 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu chur 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always full of water.

original: lung las ni chu chen po sdud pa'i don dang / mi skye ba'i don dang / gcig tu 'gyur ba'i don dang / mi zad pa'i don gyis chu gter chen po dang / chu'i chu chen po'i bar dag yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lung las ni chu chen po sdud pa'i don dang / mi skye ba'i don dang / gcig tu 'gyur ba'i don dang / mi zad pa'i don gyis chu gter chen po dang / chu'i chu chen po'i bar dag yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: According to the scriptures, the great reservoir is the great collection of water, the great flow of water, because it is the meaning of non-arising, the meaning of unity, and the meaning of inexhaustibility.üîΩThe section of the sutra called the Great Flood is finished.

original: thags 'khrugs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: thags 'khrugs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The section of the sutra called the Tangled Mass is finished.

original: de la nor dang khyim dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la sred pas phan tshun du sems 'phrog pa nyid kyi phyir thags 'khrugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la nor dang khyim dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la sred pas phan tshun du sems 'phrog pa nyid kyi phyir thags 'khrugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a tangled knot because the mind is distracted by mutual attachment to wealth, home, sons, wives, etc.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa mang du byed pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba dka' ba nyid kyis gru bu 'dzings pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: yang na ma lus par bral ba dang mi ldan pa'i skabs 'dri ba'o //

analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no //

original: ji skad du /üîΩ'du byed sdug bsngal nyid dang ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid dang ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe Buddha, the perfect knower,üîΩknowing the suffering of formations

analyzed: 'gyur ba nyid du mkhyen nas ni // rdzogs sangs rab tu mkhyen pa yis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sdug bsngal nyid dgongs pa can yin pa de'i dgongs pa ston pa yin no //

translated: In the scriptures, the Buddha taught the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change from the point of view of the suffering of the essential nature of the five aggregates.üîΩHe taught the suffering of formations from the point of view of the suffering of formations.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //

original: srog gcod pa dang drag shul can dang lag pa khrag dmar ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang drag shul can dang lag pa khrag dmar ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage, ‚Äúhe is a killer, violent, and bloody-handed,‚Äù is a summary verse from the sutra.

original: de la bsad pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / bsad par sbyor ba nyid dang / de gnyis ka la mngon par dga' ba nyid dang / de'i gzhi nyid dang / de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyis srog gcod pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la bsad pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / bsad par sbyor ba nyid dang / de gnyis ka la mngon par dga' ba nyid dang / de'i gzhi nyid dang / de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyis srog gcod pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: In this passage, killing is taught by way of the intention to kill, the application to kill, delighting in both of those, the basis of that, and the connection with that.

original: de'i gzhi yang kha na ma tho ba de la ngo tsha ba med pa dang / snying mi brtse ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi yang kha na ma tho ba de la ngo tsha ba med pa dang / snying mi brtse ba yang yin te /

original: srog chags phra mo sdug bsngal ba mi mkho ba rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: srog chags phra mo sdug bsngal ba mi mkho ba rnams la yang ngo //

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid ni ji srid du mi spong ba'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid ni ji srid du mi spong ba'o //

original: gsod pa ni gsod par byed pa ste 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsod pa ni gsod par byed pa ste 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya'o //

original: rab tu gsod pa ni rnam pa nas gsod pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu gsod pa ni rnam pa nas gsod pa ste /

original: rnam pa re re nas 'chi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa re re nas 'chi bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drag shul can nyid kyis ni shan pa la sogs pa'i srog gcod pa nyid khyad par du byed pa yin no //

original: drag shul can nyid kyang lus drag shul can nyid dang / sems drag shul can nyid dang / der gcig tu nges pa nyid dang / der gtan du ba nyid kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: drag shul can nyid kyang lus drag shul can nyid dang / sems drag shul can nyid dang / der gcig tu nges pa nyid dang / der gtan du ba nyid kyis ston par byed do //
translated: Cruelty is shown by the cruelty of the body, the cruelty of the mind, the certainty of that, and the permanence of that.

original: de la ngo tsha ba med pa nyid dang / snying mi brtse ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni der gcig tu nges pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha ba med pa nyid dang / snying mi brtse ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni der gcig tu nges pa nyid yin la /
translated: The certainty of that is due to the absence of shame and the absence of compassion.

original: mi spong ba nyid kyis ni der bstan du ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩdge slong dag gson pa rnams las gnyid log pa ni stong pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //

translated: The permanence of that is due to the absence of rejection.üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, those who are asleep among the living are empty.‚Äù This is a passage from a Sutra.

original: gson pa rnams las gnyid log par stong pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gson pa rnams las gnyid log par stong pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are asleep among the living are empty‚Äù is the teaching.

original: ltag ma rnams ni bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ltag ma rnams ni bshad pa yin no //

original: de la gang dag la gnyid mi 'byung ba gson pa'i bya ba dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag la gnyid mi 'byung ba gson pa'i bya ba dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: gson pa dag ni brtson 'grus rtsom //
analyzed: gson pa dag ni brtson 'grus rtsom //
translated: The living engage in effortüîΩand the fruit of the latter is
