analyzed: de las phyi mar 'bras bu dang // dge sbyong tshul don rnams gzhan yang // 'di yi longs spyod bde ba 'byung //
translated: the purpose of the ascetic life and other things.üîΩThe enjoyment of these things is happiness.

original: de dag phyir gnyid log pa yi //
analyzed: de dag phyir gnyid log pa yi //
translated: Sleep is considered useless

original: srog ni gsog dang 'bras med dang // don med pa dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: srog ni gsog dang 'bras med dang // don med pa dang de bzhin du //
translated: because it is a waste of life, fruitless,

original: phan yon med pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: phan yon med pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: meaningless, and without benefit.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir gsog yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir gsog yin na /
translated: Moreover, sleep is a waste because it is devoid of human effort.

original: phal cher rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'o //
translated: It is fruitless because it is not usually a ripening cause.

original: yang dag pa yul du ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir don med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa yul du ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir don med pa'o //
translated: It is meaningless because it is not a proper object.

original: @51a * // dus ma yin par gnyid log pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid 'du byed pa'i phyir phan yon med pa'o //
analyzed: @51a * // dus ma yin par gnyid log pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid 'du byed pa'i phyir phan yon med pa'o //
translated: Sleep at the wrong time is without benefit because it produces unserviceability of body and mind.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gnyid kyi gnas skabs sems med pa ni stong pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gnyid kyi gnas skabs sems med pa ni stong pa yin la /
translated: Another explanation: the mindless state of sleep is emptiness.

original: gnyid kyi gnas skabs sems dang bcas pa ni lhag ma ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid kyi gnas skabs sems dang bcas pa ni lhag ma ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The state of sleep with mind is the remainder, as before.

original: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage from the sutra, ‚ÄúThe foolish, confused, unskillful person,‚Äù is a quotation.

original: de la byis pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de la byis pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúfoolish‚Äù is the teaching.

original: lhag ma bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma bshad pa yin te /
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he possesses ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge.

original: tshul bzhin yin pa la mkhas pa ni mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yin pa la mkhas pa ni mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Skillful in what is proper‚Äù is unskillful.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gnyis te /üîΩbyis pa ni nyes par bsams pa sems pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gnyis te / byis pa ni nyes par bsams pa sems pa la sogs pas so //
translated: There is another explanation in two parts.üîΩThe foolish person is so because of his thoughts, etc., which are wrongly directed.

original: rmongs pa dang mi gsal ba dang mi mkhas pa ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang mi gsal ba dang mi mkhas pa ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: The confused, unskillful person is so because he lacks the wisdoms born from learning, reflection, and meditation, respectively.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la byung ba'i shes rab rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang byis pa nas mi mkhas pa'i bar ro //üîΩbyis pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la byung ba'i shes rab rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang byis pa nas mi mkhas pa'i bar ro // byis pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Because they are not endowed with the wisdom that arises from birth, from listening, from reflection, and from meditation, they are foolish up to unskilled.üîΩThey are foolish by nature.

original: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can /üîΩshes rab 'chal pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can / shes rab 'chal pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
translated: They are deluded by nature.üîΩThey are of perverted understanding by nature.

original: de ni go rims bzhin du mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: This is a summary of the sutra. It should be understood that they are endowed with ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge, respectively.

original: gzhan yang shes rab ma byang ba dang / zhan pa dang / log pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab ma byang ba dang / zhan pa dang / log pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, they are unrefined, weak, and perverted in wisdom, respectively.

original: gzhan yang rang gis legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir byis pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gis legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir byis pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Moreover, they are foolish by nature because they are unable to understand the meaning of the Dharma that is well-spoken or badly spoken by themselves.

original: thos kyang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: thos kyang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: They are deluded by nature because they are unable to understand even when they hear it.

original: phyin ci log tu mngon du zhen pa'i phyir shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mngon du zhen pa'i phyir shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: They are of the nature of bad understanding, because they are the adherence to the manifest that is contrary to reality.üîΩThis is a passage from a Sutra:

original: gro bzhin skyes dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: gro bzhin skyes dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO Son of good family, whether it be a monk or a brahman, whoever says that form is impermanent, that is a part of the Sutra.

original: de la gzugs mi rtag pa nas rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar gyis ni lus skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid ston par byed la /üîΩmi brtan pas ni dus yun mi ring bar 'jig pa nyid do //

original: 'dir yang smras pa /

analyzed: rtog ge la zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yin te /

analyzed: gzhan yang lung las ni rtog ge ba sngar rig par bya ste /

analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa bsal ba'i phyir tsher ma phyung pa rnams yin no //

analyzed: bden pa de yang lus kyis mngon sum du 'du byed pa ni gnas gyur pa'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: shes rab kyis so sor 'bigs par byed pa ni bdag gis mngon sum du byas so zhes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'jal ba dang nye bar rtog pa gnyis kyis ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni de bzhin nyid so @55a * //
translated: The path of seeing evaluates reality because it thoroughly investigates reality.

original: sor rtog pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med pa gnyis kyis mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir 'jal bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni ji ltar 'jal ba la yang dang yang du rtog par byed pa'i phyir nye bar rtog par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: bden pa de yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi dbang du mdzad nas chos bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pha yin no //

analyzed: yon gnas kyi khyad par gyi sde'i spyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su spyad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dge ba rgyun rgyas pa yin no //

analyzed: @55b gzhan yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams rgyun rgyas pa de nyid dge ba rgyun rgyas pa yin te /

analyzed: skyes pa dang du mi len pa'i phyir shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-protected‚Äù means that he does not acquiesce in their arising.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs la brtan nas shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs la brtan nas shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-restrained‚Äù means that he is based on the power of mundane meditation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la brtan nas shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la brtan nas shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: and by transcending the world, it is well cultivated.

original: de ltar na sems dul ba thabs dang bcas pa yongs su brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems dul ba thabs dang bcas pa yongs su brtan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the disciplined mind is well guarded and well cultivated.

original: 'dir yang smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: dran pas ma skyes phyir sbas shing //
analyzed: dran pas ma skyes phyir sbas shing //
translated: It is well guarded because it is not born through forgetfulness.

original: shes bzhin gyis ni skyes las bsrungs //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis ni skyes las bsrungs //
translated: It is well protected because it is born through vigilance.üîΩIt is well restrained and well cultivated

original: gnon dang rtsa ba bcom gnyis kyis //üîΩbsdams dang bsgoms pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: gnon dang rtsa ba bcom gnyis kyis // bsdams dang bsgoms pa yin par 'dod //
translated: through suppression and the destruction of the root.

original: lung las ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir shin tu sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: lung las ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir shin tu sbas pa yin no //
translated: In the scriptures, it is said that the disciplined mind is well guarded because it does not engage in what should not be engaged in.

original: 'jug par bya ba la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba la dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pas 'jug pa'i phyir shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: It is well protected because it engages in what should be engaged in through the application of mindfulness.

original: rang nyid yul la mi rgyug pa'i phyir shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid yul la mi rgyug pa'i phyir shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
translated: It is well restrained because it does not itself run to objects.

original: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: It is well cultivated because it does not itself become defiled.

original: de ltar na shin tu dul ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu dul ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is said to be well disciplined.

original: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa mind endowed with love, a mind that is not hostile, a mind that is not inimical‚Äù is a citation from a sutra.

original: de la sems can pha rol dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems can pha rol dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: Love is the desire that living beings enjoy happiness and possess its causes.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni byams pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni byams pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The mind that is associated with that is ‚Äúendowed with love.‚Äù

original: de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir kho na med pa dang 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir kho na med pa dang 'gran zla med pa dang / gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúnot hostile‚Äù because it is the antidote to the three kinds of resentment. It is ‚Äúnot inimical‚Äù because it is the antidote to the three kinds of malice.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can mnyam pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnod pa byed pa dag la khon du 'dzin pa dang / gnod pa mi byed pa dag la phrag dog dang / de gnyis dang ldan pa'i dman pa dag la ni gnag gis na de dag la gnod par 'gyur ba'i zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can mnyam pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnod pa byed pa dag la khon du 'dzin pa dang / gnod pa mi byed pa dag la phrag dog dang / de gnyis dang ldan pa'i dman pa dag la ni gnag gis na de dag la gnod par 'gyur ba'i zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The three kinds of resentment are the desire to harm those who have harmed oneself, those who have harmed one‚Äôs friends, and those who have benefited one‚Äôs enemies; the three kinds of malice are the desire to harm those who are equal, superior, or inferior to oneself.

original: 'bras bu che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yangs pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúvast‚Äù because it has a great result.

original: gzugs na spyod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is vast because it is practiced in the form realm.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad med @57a * //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad med @57a * //
translated: It is immeasurable because it takes immeasurable sentient beings as its object.

original: pa'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu thul ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu thul ba'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa'o //
translated: It is well cultivated because it subdues the resistant tendency.

original: de ltar na gnyen po nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / sa nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid kyi sems de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / sa nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam par dag pa nyid kyi sems de yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the author has explained the mind in terms of its antidote, its result, its stage, its object, and its purity.

original: phyogs gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi gnas pa po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi gnas pa po bstan pa yin te /
translated: In one direction means that it is taught as a local state.

original: dper na khri dag 'bod do //
analyzed: dper na khri dag 'bod do //
translated: For example, one says, ‚ÄúThe thrones are crying,‚Äù

original: ri dags tshig go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri dags tshig go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: or ‚ÄúThe deer are speaking.‚Äù

original: mos te zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mos te zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: It is resolved means that it is taught as a mental attention that is resolved.

original: khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba ni khyab par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba ni khyab par ston pa yin te /
translated: It is pervaded means that it is taught as a pervasion.

original: cig car du mtha' dag la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car du mtha' dag la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is resolved in all places at once.

original: rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du gyur pa yin par de ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du gyur pa yin par de ston pa yin no //
translated: Having completed shows that the actual meditative attainment has become manifest.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par ston pa yin no //
translated: Staying shows that it continues to occur at other times.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing zhum pa med pa yin /
translated: He is energetic, not lazy.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i du ma bu'o //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs shing nyes par brtsams pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i du ma bu'o //
translated: His body is fit, not unfit.

original: de la tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa'i tshig bzhi po dag ni go rims bzhin du sems rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshig phyi mas rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa'i tshig bzhi po dag ni go rims bzhin du sems rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: The latter part of the verse explains the four phrases of the former part. The four phrases of the former part should be understood as antidotes to four types of thought.

original: sems rnam pa bzhi ni ha cang zhum pa dang / ha cang rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa ste /
analyzed: sems rnam pa bzhi ni ha cang zhum pa dang / ha cang rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa ste /
translated: The four types of thought are: excessive contraction, excessive expansion, internal contraction, and external distraction.

original: de kho na'i gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis gnyis yin no //
translated: The two types of formative influence that abandon those are antidotes to the two types of thought.

original: gzhan yang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por tshig gnyis te /
translated: Two phrases are antidotes to the secondary afflictions of serenity and complete acceptance.

original: zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are antidotes to laxity and excitement.

original: btang snyoms kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yang tshig gnyis yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yang tshig gnyis yin no //
translated: Two phrases are antidotes to the secondary afflictions of equanimity.

original: de gnyis kyang gang gis na dran pa kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba'i ma rig pa dang / gang gis na ro myang ba la sems rnam par g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang gang gis na dran pa kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba'i ma rig pa dang / gang gis na ro myang ba la sems rnam par g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i sred pa'o //
translated: They are the ignorance that causes forgetfulness of the instructions and the craving that causes the mind to be distracted by the taste of meditative concentration.

original: gzhan yang skyon rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por tshig bzhi dag yin no /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por tshig bzhi dag yin no /
translated: Four phrases are antidotes to four faults.

original: skyon rnam pa bzhi ni brtson 'grus ma brtsams na sems zhum par 'gyur ba dang / ha cang brtsams na lus dub bar 'gyur ba dang / brjod ngas ba  @57b dang sems nyams pa ste gang gis na lus nyes par brtsams pa dang / dran pa kun tu rmongs pa dang sems rtse gcig pa ma yin pa ste yul rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon rnam pa bzhi ni brtson 'grus ma brtsams na sems zhum par 'gyur ba dang / ha cang brtsams na lus dub bar 'gyur ba dang / brjod ngas ba  @57b dang sems nyams pa ste gang gis na lus nyes par brtsams pa dang / dran pa kun tu rmongs pa dang sems rtse gcig pa ma yin pa ste yul rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four faults are: the mind becomes depressed when one does not begin striving; the body becomes exhausted when one strives too much; and one's memory fails and the mind becomes impaired, because one has exerted the body improperly, and because one is confused and the mind is not one-pointed, due to distraction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen po nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir brtson 'grus la sogs pa tshig phyi mas khyad par du byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen po nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir brtson 'grus la sogs pa tshig phyi mas khyad par du byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the antidotes to those, one should understand that striving, etc. are distinguished by the subsequent verses.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni mig skyes shing zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni mig skyes shing zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Proper mental attention is the verse beginning with the eye is produced - this is a passage from a Sutra.

original: de la don mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mig go //
analyzed: de la don mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mig go //
translated: Therein, the eye is uncontaminated wisdom, because the meaning is directly perceived.

original: the tshom med pa'i phyir shes pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is due to the absence of doubt.

original: yang dag pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge because it is the direct realization of reality.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir blo ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir blo ste /
translated: It is understanding because it is pure.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi chos nyid kyi rgyus na rnam par dag pa'i phyir blo yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi chos nyid kyi rgyus na rnam par dag pa'i phyir blo yin no //
translated: It is understanding because it is pure, due to the reality of the etymological explanation.

original: mig la zhan pa dang / nor ba dang / rnyog ba nyid med par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum gyi khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la zhan pa dang / nor ba dang / rnyog ba nyid med par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum gyi khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: It is distinguished as threefold because it is taught as the absence of weakness, error, and turbidity in the eye.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba ni bden pa rnams la ngan par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba ni bden pa rnams la ngan par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, the views of the non-Buddhists are not the antidotes to wrong views, doubt, and ignorance regarding the truths, and they are contaminated. Therefore, the eye, etc. are mentioned in order to distinguish them from that.

original: gzhan yang bzlas pa gsum dag la thog mar mthong ba ni mig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang bzlas pa gsum dag la thog mar mthong ba ni mig go //
translated: Moreover, in the three repetitions, seeing is the eye at the beginning.

original: ji ltar mthong bal rnam par dpyod pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bal rnam par dpyod pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The investigation of what is seen is knowledge.

original: gnyis po de nyid ji snyed yod pa can nyid la brten nas rig pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis po de nyid ji snyed yod pa can nyid la brten nas rig pa ste /
translated: The second is knowledge, because it is based on the existence of all things,

original: ji snyed yod pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar yod pa can nyid la brten nas blo ste /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar yod pa can nyid la brten nas blo ste /
translated: because it grasps the existence of all things.üîΩThe third is understanding, because it is based on the existence of reality,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it realizes reality as it is.

original: gzhan yang chos ma thos pa rnams la rjes su dpag pa dgag pa'i phyir mig ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos ma thos pa rnams la rjes su dpag pa dgag pa'i phyir mig ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, in order to refute the inference of those who have not heard the teaching, he says ‚Äúeye.‚Äù

original: mos pa las byung ba'i mthong ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pas so //üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal dgag pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba'i mthong ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pas so // mngon pa'i nga rgyal dgag pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
translated: In order to refute the seeing that arises from mere faith, he says ‚Äúknowledge.‚ÄùüîΩIn order to refute the pride of self-conceit, he says ‚Äúawareness.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir blo ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir blo ste /
translated: In order to refute the claim that it is contaminated, he says ‚Äúunderstanding,‚Äù

original: rnam par dag pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i don gyis so //
translated: because it has the meaning of purification.

original: kha cig na re bzod pa ni mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mig yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re bzod pa ni mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mig yin la /
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúPatience is the eye because it is seeing,

original: shes pa ni shes pa nyid yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa nyid yin no zhes zer te /
translated: and knowledge is knowledge itself.‚Äù

original: de ni bzlas pa gsum dag la 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzlas pa gsum dag la 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not tenable in the three repetitions.

original: de dag ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyis @58a * //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyis @58a * //
translated: They are the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning.üîΩ

original: bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no-training.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni khyed la phan pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni khyed la phan pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, this is for your benefit‚Äù is a part of the sutra.

original: phan pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa bsod nyams kyi rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spang pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa'i phyir ni 'dod pa bsod nyams kyi rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spang pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFor benefit‚Äù is the avoidance of the extreme of indulgence in pleasure.

original: bde ba'i phyir ni bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spong ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni bdag nyid dub par gnas pa'i rjes su sbyor ba'i mtha' yongs su spong ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFor happiness‚Äù is the avoidance of the extreme of indulgence in self-mortification.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni gnyis ka'i mtha' spangs nas dbu ma ba'i lam bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni gnyis ka'i mtha' spangs nas dbu ma ba'i lam bsgom pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFor benefit and happiness‚Äù is the cultivation of the middle way, avoiding both extremes.

original: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúfor benefit‚Äù is the cultivation of the antidote to the secondary defilement of suffering.

original: bde ba'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa rnams med par sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa rnams med par sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFor happiness‚Äù is the cultivation of the antidote to suffering without defilements.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni bde ba dang bcas ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni bde ba dang bcas ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to the afflictions that is accompanied by pleasure is for the sake of benefit and pleasure.

original: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams ma rtogs par nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam mo //üîΩbde ba'i phyir ni 'dir nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam ma gtogs pa'i lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams ma rtogs par nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam mo // bde ba'i phyir ni 'dir nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam ma gtogs pa'i lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam mo //
translated: Moreover, the path of the exhaustion of the afflictions, which is the higher thought of abiding in bliss in this life, is for the sake of benefit.üîΩThe path of abiding in bliss in this life, which is the higher thought, is for the sake of pleasure, excluding the path of the exhaustion of the afflictions.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni lhag pa'i sems mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa zad pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of the exhaustion of the afflictions, which is the higher thought of abiding in bliss in this life, is for the sake of benefit and pleasure.

original: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi dka' ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan pa'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi dka' ba'i lam mo //
translated: Moreover, the difficult path of those in training is for the sake of benefit.

original: bde ba'i phyir ni mi slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ni mi slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The easy path of those beyond training is for the sake of pleasure.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam yin te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ni slob pa rnams kyi sla ba'i lam yin te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The path of the learner is easy to follow for the sake of benefit and happiness, respectively.

original: shing thags btsugs pa ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: shing thags btsugs pa ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The planting of the fence is a section of the sutra.

original: de la zabs ring ba ni zabs ring du btsugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zabs ring ba ni zabs ring du btsugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: legs par btsugs pa ni blo nas legs par brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro /

original: sra ba ni mi 'drul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra ba ni mi 'drul ba'i phyir ro //

original: brtan pa ni yun ring du gnas pa'i shing yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa ni yun ring du gnas pa'i shing yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mkhregs pa dang ldan pa ni shun pa med pa dang / khong na lung med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhregs pa dang ldan pa ni shun pa med pa dang / khong na lung med pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi g-yo ba ni mi 'gul ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mi 'gul ba'i phyir la /

original: mi 'chag pa ni mi chogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'chag pa ni mi chogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is unshakable because it does not break.

original: zabs ring ba dang legs par btsugs pa'i gzhi'i khyad par gyis ni mi g-yo ba yin la /
analyzed: zabs ring ba dang legs par btsugs pa'i gzhi'i khyad par gyis ni mi g-yo ba yin la /

original: sra ba dang brtan @58b pa dang mkhregs pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis mi 'chag pa yin pas gzhi dang rang bzhin gyi khyad par de gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sra ba dang brtan @58b pa dang mkhregs pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis mi 'chag pa yin pas gzhi dang rang bzhin gyi khyad par de gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is not destroyed by the special nature of solidity, stability, and hardness. Thus, the two special natures of basis and nature are in order.

original: de ltar na de dag ni rnam pa gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis kyi gzhi nyid dang / rang bzhin nyid dang / des byas /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni rnam pa gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis kyi gzhi nyid dang / rang bzhin nyid dang / des byas /

original: pa'i phan yon gyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi gnas mi thod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phan yon gyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi gnas mi thod pa yin no //

original: longs spyod bskyod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: longs spyod bskyod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //

original: de la pa skyod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtsal gyis bsgrubs pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la pa skyod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtsal gyis bsgrubs pa nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa dang / nyal ba'i bde ba gnyis kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin no //

analyzed: rdul med med dri ma chags chags su bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ni ngal bas bsgrubs pa yin no //

analyzed: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas bsgrubs pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn accordance with the Dharma, earned by the Dharma‚Äù means earned in a proper way.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyi phyir chos dang ldan zhing ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyi phyir chos dang ldan zhing ngo //

analyzed: bsod nams kyis thob pa'i phyir chos kyis thob pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúEarned by the Dharma‚Äù means earned by merit.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas la sogs par gtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir chos dang ldan zhing ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas la sogs par gtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir chos dang ldan zhing ngo //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúin accordance with the Dharma‚Äù means not belonging to the Buddha, etc.

original: log pa'i 'tsho bas thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i 'tsho bas thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyis thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEarned by the Dharma‚Äù means not earned by wrong livelihood.

original: phan yon tshe phyi ma la 'gro ba gang mar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: phan yon tshe phyi ma la 'gro ba gang mar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat benefits will come in future lives?‚Äù is a summary verse of the sutra.

original: de la 'gro ba 'og ma ni ngan song rnams yin no //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba 'og ma ni ngan song rnams yin no //
translated: In this verse, ‚Äúfuture lives‚Äù refers to the lower realms.

original: de'i 'gro ba gong mar gyur pa ni mi rnams te /
analyzed: de'i 'gro ba gong mar gyur pa ni mi rnams te /

analyzed: der 'gro bar byed pa'i phan yon ni 'gro ba gang mar 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: de las kyang gang zhig mi'i skal ba bzang po'i 'bras bu smin par byed pa de ni skal ba bzang por 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: de las kyang gang zhig lus dang longs spyod yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu smin par byed pa de ni rnam par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: gang zhig lhar skye bar byed pa de ni mtho ris 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who causes rebirth as a god is the one who accomplishes the higher realms.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba gong mar 'gyur ba de nyid lhag mas gsal bar byed pa yin no //üîΩskyes bu dam @59a * //

analyzed: pa'i 'gro ba bdun dag gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //

analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba ci zhe na 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i skye ba gzhan gyi gnas skabs so //

analyzed: bdun nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i dus kyis dbye ba las so //

analyzed: de las ni rton pa la 'gro ba zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: In that verse, ‚Äúattains‚Äù means ‚Äúrelies on.‚Äù

original: bdag ma byung yang rung bdag gi yang srid pa ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni mya las 'das pa la 'dod pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la sbyor ba yin no //üîΩbdag mi 'byung bar 'gyur /üîΩbdag gi lus 'di mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyis skye ba sun 'byin pa'i phyir smon pa med pa la sbyor ba yin no //

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang smon pa dang nges pa'i dus gnyis su mya ngan las 'das pa la sems rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang mtshan ma med pa la sbyor ba kho na yin no //

original: de ltar na gang yod pa zhes bya ba ni phung po tsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar na gang yod pa zhes bya ba ni phung po tsam mo //

original: gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas so //

original: de spong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas mi rtag pa tsam 'gog par mthong ba'i phyir btang snyoms 'thob kyi bdag mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dper na rnam par grol ba'i rgyus len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: kha cig las ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa yin par 'byung ste /

original: dper na kye ma dge slong nye bar zhi ba zag @59b pa med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dper na kye ma dge slong nye bar zhi ba zag @59b pa med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: For example, it says, ‚ÄúOh, a bhik·π£u who is peaceful, who possesses the uncontaminated state,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan par gyur pa /
translated: who is free from attachment, who is not possessed,

original: len pa med par mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni legs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: len pa med par mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni legs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: who attains nirvana without remainder‚Äîthat is excellent.‚Äù

original: 'di ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa la bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: 'di ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa la bya bar mngon te /
translated: This is clearly about the non-existence of the remainder of the aggregates.

original: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / shar phyogs su 'gro bar mi smra zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in terms of the destiny in the next life that one is said to go to a good or bad destiny, and because it is said in detail that one does not go to the east.

analyzed: yod pa la yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage, ‚ÄúThe existence of existence,‚Äù etc., is a citation from a sutra.üîΩThere, it is said:

translated: ‚ÄúOne who knows existence through emptiness,üîΩknows nonexistence through nonexistence.

analyzed: yod nyid med la med nyid rig / de nas ji ltar gang yod la //

analyzed: gnyis kyis bla bcas bla med rig / gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa gnyis kyis so //

translated: The order of the concentrations of emptiness, etc., is also for that reason.üîΩOne who knows existent and nonexistent things is able to know the two, existence with and without remainder.

original: gyin ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gyin ni ma yin la /
translated: But not one who does not know existent and nonexistent things.

original: shes na yod pa bla ma dang bcas pa yin na ni yid kyis smon par mi byed la /
analyzed: shes na yod pa bla ma dang bcas pa yin na ni yid kyis smon par mi byed la /

original: gzhan yang smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang smras pa /

original: bdag 'dzin phyir dang srid la srid //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin phyir dang srid la srid //

original: stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin rnams //
analyzed: stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin rnams //

analyzed: de ltar na yod pa la skyon yon zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la ste go rims bzhin no //

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i thabs yongs su bzung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba zhum pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba spang ba la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i thabs yongs su bzung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de lan mang du bya ba dang / brtan por bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba zhum pa dang /
translated: because they are asserted to abandon the preparation for non-equipoise, and so on; because they are the method for fully taking up the latter; because they are the frequent practice and firm practice of the latter; and because they are the cultivation of the antidotes to laxity and excitement in the preparation for equipoise.

original: rgod pa'i gnyen po'i bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir de dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen po'i bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir de dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in that order.

original: gzhan yang spang pa la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de dag la sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de la brtson pa'i lus dang sems dub par gyur na brtson 'grus rgyun mi chad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir yang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang spang pa la sogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de dag la sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de la brtson pa'i lus dang sems dub par gyur na brtson 'grus rgyun mi chad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir yang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, they are in that order because they are asserted to abandon, and so on; because they are the preparation for those; because when the body and mind of one who is striving in them become weary, they are the uninterrupted striving; and because they are the abandonment of the secondary afflictions of calm abiding and insight.

original: gzhan yang rtsol bar byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus na brtson 'grus brtsams pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bsgom pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtsol bar byed pa ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus na brtson 'grus brtsams pa la brten pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bsgom pa'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is effort because it is based on the exertion of striving when there is discernment, and it is based on meditative concentration when there is cultivation.

original: sems zhum pa rab tu bzung nas nang du rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir na dge slog ma'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems zhum pa rab tu bzung nas nang du rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir na dge slog ma'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For, after one has thoroughly taken hold of a depressed mind, one thoroughly stabilizes it internally.

original: 'dus pa dan ldan pa tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa dan ldan pa tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúendowed with an assembly, endowed with a multitude‚Äù is a fragment of a s≈´tra.

original: 'khor dang / blo dang / yid ches pa dang / mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'khor dang / blo dang / yid ches pa dang / mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: It shows the perfection of retinue, mind, confidence, and worship.

original: 'dus pa dang ldan pa tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa dang ldan pa tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with an assembly, endowed with a multitude‚Äù shows the perfection of retinue.

original: nyan pa po'i tshogs 'dus pa dang 'khod pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i tshogs 'dus pa dang 'khod pa dang go rims bzhin no //

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni blo phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni blo phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin te /

original: de rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyi rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la rang gi bstan bcos kyi rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the teachers of his treatise.

original: skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rang bzhin du kun tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rang bzhin du kun tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase he is known to many as virtuous refers to his perfection of trust,

original: mang po rnams kyis rtogs pa la yid @60b ches pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po rnams kyis rtogs pa la yid @60b ches pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba zhes bya ba ni mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba zhes bya ba ni mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase he is honored by a great assembly refers to his perfection of worship,üîΩbecause he is worshipped by a great assembly.

original: dmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o /
analyzed: dmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o /
translated: The phrase this Dharma is profound refers to the section of the sutra.

original: de yang de las bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bdag med pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni sngon shes rab ma sbyangs bas rang gis mthong bar dka' ba yin te des na zab pa'o //üîΩston pa na khong du chud par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang de las bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bdag med pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de ni sngon shes rab ma sbyangs bas rang gis mthong bar dka' ba yin te des na zab pa'o // ston pa na khong du chud par dka' ba yin te /
translated: And that is because the Lord's realization of the selflessness of dharmas is the subject matter of the sutra.üîΩ It is profound because it is difficult for those who have not previously cultivated wisdom to see.

original: des na zab par snang ba'o //
analyzed: des na zab par snang ba'o //
translated: It appears profound because it is difficult to understand when it is taught.

original: rang gi rtag par mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rtag par mi nus pa yin te /
translated: It is not possible to see it,

original: des na mthong bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: des na mthong bar dka' ba'o //
translated: therefore it is difficult to see.

original: ston pa na rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: ston pa na rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /

original: des na khong du chud par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: des na khong du chud par dka' ba ste /
translated: therefore it is difficult to understand.

original: de ni rtog ge la ma grags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtog ge la ma grags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang 'dir bdag med pa ston pa kho na chos yin te /üîΩdon dam par mthong bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir bdag med pa ston pa kho na chos yin te / don dam par mthong bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here the teaching of selflessness is the Dharma,üîΩbecause it is profound, since it is difficult to see ultimately.

original: kun rdzob kyi don du khong du chud par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir zab par snang ba'o //üîΩdon dam par brtag par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir mthong bar dka' ba'o //

translated: It is the appearance of profundity, since it is difficult to understand conventionally.üîΩIt is difficult to see, since it is not possible to investigate it ultimately.

original: kun rdzob kyi don du rtog ge spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir khong du chud par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi don du rtog ge spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir khong du chud par dka' ba ste /

original: don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad pas de'i rtog ge la rgyu ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad pas de'i rtog ge la rgyu ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar na ji ltar na zab pa zab par snang ba dang / rgyu gang gi yin pa de tshig gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar na zab pa zab par snang ba dang / rgyu gang gi yin pa de tshig gnyis dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //

original: da ni de lta bu'i chos de sus rig par nus she na /
analyzed: da ni de lta bu'i chos de sus rig par nus she na /

original: zhib mor brtags pa'i mkhas pa dang mdzangs pas rig par zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩde la zhib mo ni de kho na'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir la /

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin dang ji snyed yod pa nyid can gyi rgyus so //

original: de gnyis kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
