original: rnam par g-yengs pa ni sems gzhan du 'phros pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa ni sems gzhan du 'phros pa'o //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind to other objects.

original: bsdus pa ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis sems zhum pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis sems zhum pa nyid du'o //
translated: Contraction is the depression of the mind due to torpor and sleep.

original: legs par yid la mi byed pa ni dgongs pa dang chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: legs par yid la mi byed pa ni dgongs pa dang chos nyid la phyin ci log pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Non-attention is the non-attention to the intention and the reality of the teaching.

original: rab tu yid la mi byed pa ni 'dun pa dang 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rab tu yid la mi byed pa ni 'dun pa dang 'jug pa zhan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Non-attention is the weak attention due to weak aspiration and weak application.

original: lung las ni skyon rnam pa drug gi gnyen por rnam pa bcu drug dag yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: lung las ni skyon rnam pa drug gi gnyen por rnam pa bcu drug dag yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The scriptures state that the sixteen aspects are antidotes to the six faults.

original: skyon drug ni las kyi skyon dang / mos pa med pa'i skyon dang / mchod par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / bsam pa'i skyon dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi skyon dang / 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: skyon drug ni las kyi skyon dang / mos pa med pa'i skyon dang / mchod par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / bsam pa'i skyon dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi skyon dang / 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
translated: The six faults are: the fault of action, the fault of lack of devotion, the fault of lack of worship, the fault of thought, the fault of lack of harmony, and the fault of retention.

original: de la las kyi skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la las kyi skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The fault of action is threefold:

original: lus kyi las kyi skyon ni spyod lam mi sdug par 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi skyon ni spyod lam mi sdug par 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of bodily action is the fault of remaining in an unpleasant posture.

original: lus dang ngag gi skyon ni de nyid kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi skyon ni de nyid kyis skul bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faults of body and speech are not to be aroused by that.

original: yid kyi las kyi skyon ni nyan par mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid kyi las kyi skyon ni nyan par mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The fault of mental action is not wishing to listen.

original: bsam pa'i skyon ni gzhan la klan ka btsal ba dang / 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i skyon ni gzhan la klan ka btsal ba dang / 'di lta bu zhig tu rgol ba las thar bar bya ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The fault of intention is the intention to find fault with others and to escape from the argument by saying, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa nyid kyi skyon ni rnam pa lnga dag ste /üîΩde la chos la ni nges par 'byin @65a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid kyi skyon ni rnam pa lnga dag ste / de la chos la ni nges par 'byin @65a * //
translated: The fault of disagreement is fivefold.

original: pa ma yin par go ba nyid kyis gus pa med pa dang / tshig dang yi ge ma 'brel ba nyid kyis brnyas pa'o //
analyzed: pa ma yin par go ba nyid kyis gus pa med pa dang / tshig dang yi ge ma 'brel ba nyid kyis brnyas pa'o //
translated: Therein, with regard to the Dharma, there is lack of respect due to understanding that it does not lead to deliverance, and contempt due to the lack of connection between the words and the syllables.

original: gang zag la ni tshul khrims dang / tshig dang / tshig 'byin pa'i skyon gyis gus pa med pa dang / rigs kyi skyon gyis brnyas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la ni tshul khrims dang / tshig dang / tshig 'byin pa'i skyon gyis gus pa med pa dang / rigs kyi skyon gyis brnyas pa'o //
translated: With regard to the person, there is lack of respect due to the faults of morality, speech, and delivery, and contempt due to the faults of family.

original: khong du chud pa dang / sgrub pa'i nus pa mi 'byung snyam pa'i bdag nyid la brnyas pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa dang / sgrub pa'i nus pa mi 'byung snyam pa'i bdag nyid la brnyas pa'o //
translated: There is contempt for oneself, thinking that one is not capable of understanding and practice.

original: 'dzin pa'i skyon yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i skyon yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five faults of retention:

original: log par 'dzin pa dang / don mi 'dzin pa dang / tshig 'bru mi 'dzin pa dang / brda ma sprad par 'dzin pa dang / ma lus par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa dang / don mi 'dzin pa dang / tshig 'bru mi 'dzin pa dang / brda ma sprad par 'dzin pa dang / ma lus par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: misretaining, not retaining the meaning, not retaining the words, retaining without analysis, and not retaining the whole.

original: lhag ma ni go sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: gsung grong khyer ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
analyzed: gsung grong khyer ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste /
translated: The city is a part of the sutra.

original: 'dis ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa rnams kyis gsung yon tan drug dag dang ldan par yongs su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa rnams kyis gsung yon tan drug dag dang ldan par yongs su ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the compilers fully demonstrate the speech with six qualities.

original: gsung snyan pa nyid dang tshig 'bru bzang po nyid dang / don bzang po nyid dang / zang zing med pa nyid dang / ji ltar 'os pa nyid dang / rgya che ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsung snyan pa nyid dang tshig 'bru bzang po nyid dang / don bzang po nyid dang / zang zing med pa nyid dang / ji ltar 'os pa nyid dang / rgya che ba nyid do //
translated: The six qualities of speech are: pleasantness, good words, good meaning, disinterestedness, appropriateness, and magnanimity.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis kyis na gsung snyan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis kyis na gsung snyan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Pleasantness should be understood in two ways:

original: gsung rgya che ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: gsung rgya che ba nyid kyis te /
translated: magnanimity of speech.

original: 'khor la chun par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / gsung 'jam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'khor la chun par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / gsung 'jam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because it is applied to the retinue, and because of its sweetness.

original: gnyis kyis na tshig 'bru bzang po nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis na tshig 'bru bzang po nyid yin te /
translated: It is good style by means of the other two,

original: tshig 'bru'i nges pa'i tshig legs pa nyid dang / brjod pa go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru'i nges pa'i tshig legs pa nyid dang / brjod pa go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because of the excellence of the style and because of the intelligibility of the expression.

original: lhag ma rnams ni re res te rigs pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni re res te rigs pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The other four are each by one,

original: mnyan par 'os pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bzhed pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba nyid kyis dang / spobs pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bzhed pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba nyid kyis dang / spobs pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because it is worthy to be heard, because it is not attached to gain and so on, because it is applied to the retinue as it is, and because it is endowed with immeasurable eloquence.

original: lung las ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du mdzad pa nyid dang / gsung 'jam pa nyid dang / tshig 'bru'i nges pa'i tshig legs pa nyid dang / go bar mdzad pa nyid dang / chos dang don dang ldan pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lung las ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du mdzad pa nyid dang / gsung 'jam pa nyid dang / tshig 'bru'i nges pa'i tshig legs pa nyid dang / go bar mdzad pa nyid dang / chos dang don dang ldan pa nyid dang /
translated: The scriptures state that it is the city of nirvana, that it is sweet, that it has an excellent style, that it is intelligible, that it is endowed with the Dharma and its meaning, that it is endowed with reason, and that it is endowed with the path of the twofold goal.

original: dad nas bkur sti byed pa la mi brten pa nyid dang / ran par gsung ba nyid dang / rgya che zhing thabs mkhas pa nyid kyi rgyus na gsung grong khyer gsal ba nas yongs su @65b gtugs ba med pa'i bar yin par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dad nas bkur sti byed pa la mi brten pa nyid dang / ran par gsung ba nyid dang / rgya che zhing thabs mkhas pa nyid kyi rgyus na gsung grong khyer gsal ba nas yongs su @65b gtugs ba med pa'i bar yin par 'byung ste /
translated: He is not dependent on being honored with faith, he speaks appropriately, and he speaks extensively and skillfully.

original: gsung rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa 'di ni mdor na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsung rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa 'di ni mdor na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: This speech of the Buddha, endowed with eight qualities, is in brief endowed with three qualities:

original: dbang du mdzad pa nyid ni rnam pa gcig gis so //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad pa nyid ni rnam pa gcig gis so //
translated: it is under control, due to one quality;

original: rang bzhin nyid ni gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni gnyis kyis so //
translated: it is natural, due to two qualities;

original: sbyor ba nyid ni lhag ma rnams kyis so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ni lhag ma rnams kyis so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and it is applied, due to the remaining qualities.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong rab tu mang po dag rim gro'i gnas su tshogs shing 'dus par gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sa ga dge slong rab tu mang po dag rim gro'i gnas su tshogs shing 'dus par gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Then the venerable Shariputra, to the many monks who had gathered in the assembly hall,

original: de la bkur sti byas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bkur sti byas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: he spoke this discourse.

original: bla mar byas pa nas sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bla mar byas pa nas sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad pa'o //
translated: From having made him one's guru up to with all one's heart is the explanation.

original: 'dis ni bkur sti byas nas nyan pa skyon drug dang bral bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bkur sti byas nas nyan pa skyon drug dang bral bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that listening with respect is free from six faults.

original: skyon drug ni nga rgyal gyi skyon dang / ma dad pa'i skyon dang / ma mos pa'i skyon dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i skyon dang / nang du bsdus pa'i skyon dang / skyo ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: skyon drug ni nga rgyal gyi skyon dang / ma dad pa'i skyon dang / ma mos pa'i skyon dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i skyon dang / nang du bsdus pa'i skyon dang / skyo ba'i skyon no //
translated: The six faults are: the fault of pride, the fault of lack of faith, the fault of lack of interest, the fault of external distraction, the fault of internal contraction, and the fault of weariness.

original: 'dir yang smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:üîΩPride, lack of faith, lack of interest,

original: nga rgyal dang ni ma dad dang // don du gnyer ba med nyid dang // phyi rol rnam g-yengs nang bsdus dang // skyo ba nyan pa'i dri ma yin //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ni ma dad dang // don du gnyer ba med nyid dang // phyi rol rnam g-yengs nang bsdus dang // skyo ba nyan pa'i dri ma yin //
translated: External distraction, internal contraction, and weariness are the faults of listening.

original: chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba dri ba dris pa yang shes tshig dang yig 'bru rigs pa dang 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba dri ba dris pa yang shes tshig dang yig 'bru rigs pa dang 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: Also, the questions and answers about Abhidharma and Vinaya are connected with reasoning in terms of words and letters - this is a part of the sutra.

original: 'di las ni 'dri ba rnam pa gsum la lan gdab pa yon tan brgyad dang ldan par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di las ni 'dri ba rnam pa gsum la lan gdab pa yon tan brgyad dang ldan par yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the answer to the three kinds of questions as endowed with eight good qualities.

original: don dang mtshams sbyar ba'i dbang du byas nas mi shes nas 'dri ba la ni don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis dang / mtshams sbyar ba 'brel par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don dang mtshams sbyar ba'i dbang du byas nas mi shes nas 'dri ba la ni don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis dang / mtshams sbyar ba 'brel par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: In terms of meaning and connection, the answer to the question asked out of ignorance is endowed with the good qualities of unerring meaning and connectedness.

original: chos nyid dang snga phyi'i dbang du byas nas 'gal ba'i 'dri ba la chos nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis dang / dgongs pa bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid dang snga phyi'i dbang du byas nas 'gal ba'i 'dri ba la chos nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis dang / dgongs pa bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In terms of reality and sequence, the answer to the question asked out of contradiction is endowed with the good qualities of being in accord with reality and of teaching the underlying intent.

original: 'dri ba gnyis ka la yang go bar byed pa nyid kyis dang / gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dri ba gnyis ka la yang go bar byed pa nyid kyis dang / gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: And in terms of both kinds of questions, the answer is endowed with the good qualities of being informative and of teaching in accordance with the disciples.

original: rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag 'dri ba la ni 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa @66a * //üîΩnyid kyis te /üîΩrtag 'grus skyong gi 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag gi tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag 'dri ba la ni 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa @66a * // nyid kyis te / rtag 'grus skyong gi 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag gi tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of the noble ones is the path of the noble ones.üîΩThe noble ones are those who are steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.

original: rtag pa dang 'grus par skyong ba ni rtag 'grus skyong ste /üîΩrtag tu dang bsgribs pas zag ba rnams las sems srung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang 'grus par skyong ba ni rtag 'grus skyong ste / rtag tu dang bsgribs pas zag ba rnams las sems srung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Steadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.

original: gzhan yang rigs pa nyid ni 'brel pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yin te /üîΩsnga phyi ma 'brel ba med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs pa nyid ni 'brel pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yin te / snga phyi ma 'brel ba med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Steadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.

original: rjes su mthun pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid kyis te /üîΩchos nyid dang mi mthun pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa nyid ni sbyor ba nyid kyis te /üîΩchos nyid dang mi mthun pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Steadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.üîΩSteadfast and energetic means steadfast and energetic.

original: thabs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'tsham pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'tsham pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The quality of being endowed with means is the quality of being appropriate.

original: gdul ba dang rjes su mthun par 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gdul ba dang rjes su mthun par 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the quality of being in accord with the disciples.

original: mthun pa nyid ni rtag 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs nyid kyis te /
analyzed: mthun pa nyid ni rtag 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs nyid kyis te /
translated: The quality of being in accord is the quality of being in accord with the limbs of steady perseverance.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the quality of being in accord with pure action.

original: ji ltar gsung dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bshad pa las 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gsung dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bshad pa las 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: It is just as the five aspects of melodious speech are explained in the sutras.

original: tshig snga ma phyi mas gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig snga ma phyi mas gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The later words clarify the earlier ones.

original: tshig phyi ma rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyis ni 'dri ba thams cad la lan gdab pa yon tan bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma rnam par bshad pa dang bcas pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyis ni 'dri ba thams cad la lan gdab pa yon tan bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa yin te /
translated: These four phrases, together with their explanations, indicate that all questions are answered with four good qualities.

original: snga phyi mi 'gal ba dang / chos nyid dang mthun pa dang / gdul ba dang mthun pa dang ; don gyi mchog dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: snga phyi mi 'gal ba dang / chos nyid dang mthun pa dang / gdul ba dang mthun pa dang ; don gyi mchog dang mthun pa'o //
translated: They are: not contradicting the earlier or later statements, being in accord with reality, being in accord with the disciples, and being in accord with the highest goal.

original: lung las ni tshig brgyad po dag gis lan gdab pa yon tan brgyad dang ldan par yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩyon tan brgyad dag ni don la 'jug pa nges par 'dzin pa nyid dang / 'jig rten la grags pa'i tshig dang yig 'bru dang 'brel pa nyid dang rgol ba 'gal ba'i rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / tshig zab mo'i don nges par byas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lung las ni tshig brgyad po dag gis lan gdab pa yon tan brgyad dang ldan par yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // yon tan brgyad dag ni don la 'jug pa nges par 'dzin pa nyid dang / 'jig rten la grags pa'i tshig dang yig 'bru dang 'brel pa nyid dang rgol ba 'gal ba'i rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / tshig zab mo'i don nges par byas pa nyid dang /
translated: The scriptures state that the reply is endowed with eight good qualities.

original: nyan pa po la phan 'dogs pa'i tshig dang yig 'bru rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i gzhir gnas pa nyid dang / gdul ba'i bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid dang / lung 'bogs pa dang /
analyzed: nyan pa po la phan 'dogs pa'i tshig dang yig 'bru rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i gzhir gnas pa nyid dang / gdul ba'i bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid dang / lung 'bogs pa dang /
translated: The eight good qualities are: 1) the meaning is well ascertained, 2) the words and letters are well known in the world, 3) it is in accord with the opponent‚Äôs position, 4) the meaning of the profound words is ascertained, 5) the words and letters that benefit the listener are not distracting, 6) it is well differentiated according to the inclinations and dispositions of those to be tamed, 7) it is not mixed with other positions, and 8) it is well expressed.

original: kha don byed pa dang / mos pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa dang mthun pa nyid dang / sgra ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi zhen par gtan la dbab par bstan pa nyid do /
analyzed: kha don byed pa dang / mos pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa dang mthun pa nyid dang / sgra ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi zhen par gtan la dbab par bstan pa nyid do /
translated: the meaning of the words, the meaning of the text, the meaning of the teaching, the meaning of the expression, the meaning of the explanation, the meaning of the question and answer, the meaning of the subject matter, the meaning of the purpose, the meaning of the connection, the meaning of the intention, the meaning of the hidden, the meaning of the classification, the meaning of the fault and the meaning of the good quality.

original: dge slong dag gtam la @66b 'jug par bya ba na 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste //
analyzed: dge slong dag gtam la @66b 'jug par bya ba na 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu ste //
translated: Monks, when engaging in conversation, one should not be swayed by desire, aversion, or delusion. This is a section of the sutra.

original: 'di las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam gzhi dang bcas pa spangs nas gtam gang bya ba dang / gang gi don du bya ba de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'di las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam gzhi dang bcas pa spangs nas gtam gang bya ba dang / gang gi don du bya ba de yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, having abandoned defiled conversation and its basis, it shows what kind of conversation should be done and for whose sake it should be done.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam gyi gzhi ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam gyi gzhi ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Therein, the basis of defiled conversation is ninefold:

original: rang gi phyogs rgyal bar 'dod pa dang / rang pham na phyir rgol ba la khong khro ba nyid dang / rang gi phyogs grub na sems khengs pa nyid dang / phyir rgol bas skyon byung ba glengs na de bcas par 'dod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs rgyal bar 'dod pa dang / rang pham na phyir rgol ba la khong khro ba nyid dang / rang gi phyogs grub na sems khengs pa nyid dang / phyir rgol bas skyon byung ba glengs na de bcas par 'dod pa nyid dang /
translated: Desiring victory for one's own position, aversion towards the opponent when defeated, arrogance when one's own position is established, desiring to cover up when the opponent brings up faults,

original: skyon ma byung ba glengs na khro ba dang / khros nas sha glan pa'i phyir khon du 'dzin pa dang / pham na yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid sems mi gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: skyon ma byung ba glengs na khro ba dang / khros nas sha glan pa'i phyir khon du 'dzin pa dang / pham na yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid sems mi gsal ba nyid do //
translated: When one is criticized for a fault that one has not committed, one becomes angry. And when one is angry, one holds a grudge in order to retaliate. And when one is defeated, one becomes unhappy, which is a mental state that is not clear.

original: 'di thams cad kyi rtsod pa'i rtsa ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi rtsod pa'i rtsa ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The root of all these disputes is twofold.

original: rab tu byung ba'i yang sems kyi tha ba dang / 'chab pa'i gzhi ni zag pa'i gnas dang mthun pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa'i yul rnams yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i yang sems kyi tha ba dang / 'chab pa'i gzhi ni zag pa'i gnas dang mthun pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa'i yul rnams yin te /
translated: The basis of the dispute for the ordained is the mental state of harshness and the basis of concealment. The basis of concealment is the objects of gain and honor that are conducive to the persistence of the contaminants.

original: de la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni de'i dgra bor gyur pa dag la zhe sdang skyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyi skyon 'chab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni de'i dgra bor gyur pa dag la zhe sdang skyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyi skyon 'chab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is dependent on these objects generates hatred toward those who are the enemies of these objects and conceals one's own faults.

original: de la mi ltos pa nyid kyis ni de spangs pas na rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dang po yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa nyid kyis ni de spangs pas na rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dang po yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: One who is independent of these objects abandons the first root of dispute because one has abandoned the basis of concealment.

original: gnyis pa ni lta ba'i yongs su gdung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lta ba'i yongs su gdung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is abandoned because one has eliminated the torment of views.

original: lta ba ngan pa'i sems yongs su gdung ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i sems yongs su gdung ba yin te /
translated: The mind is tormented by bad views,

original: rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of not being at peace.

original: 'dir yang smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:üîΩOne should engage in debate when one desires to defeat the opponent, to establish one‚Äôs own position, to bring out the truth, to settle a dispute, to teach the truth to those who lack understanding, to remind those who have understood, and to please the wise.üîΩBut one should not engage in debate out of desire for gain, honor, or fame, or from a desire to win.üîΩOne should not engage in debate out of anger, hatred, or spite,üîΩor out of a desire to be verbally clever.

original: rgyal dang pham byed 'dod grub dang // byung dang ma byung glengs pa dang // ma byung glengs na khro ba las //
analyzed: rgyal dang pham byed 'dod grub dang // byung dang ma byung glengs pa dang // ma byung glengs na khro ba las //
translated: One should not engage in debate out of a desire to be victorious,üîΩbecause that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,üîΩanger,üîΩdisrespect,

original: kho na du 'dzin pa 'byung ba dang // pham na gdug pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: kho na du 'dzin pa 'byung ba dang // pham na gdug pa la sogs pa //
translated: and the desire to speak harshly.üîΩOne should not engage in debate out of a desire to win,

original: bdun ni spangs nas gtam gtan bya //
analyzed: bdun ni spangs nas gtam gtan bya //
translated: because that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,üîΩanger,üîΩdisrespect,üîΩand the desire to speak harshly.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi gnyis snga ma ste //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi gnyis snga ma ste //
translated: One should not engage in debate out of a desire to win,

original: gang las skyon 'di 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang las skyon 'di 'byung ba'o //
translated: because that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,üîΩanger,üîΩdisrespect,üîΩand the desire to speak harshly.üîΩOne should not engage in debate out of a desire to win,üîΩbecause that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam ni rnam pa gsum dag gis yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam ni rnam pa gsum dag gis yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: anger,üîΩdisrespect,üîΩand the desire to speak harshly.üîΩOne should not engage in debate out of a desire to win,üîΩbecause that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,üîΩanger,üîΩdisrespect,üîΩand the desire to speak harshly.

original: ma zhi zhing tshod mi 'dzin par smra ba nyid kyi phyir dang / grub pa'i mtha' las 'das par byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan la smod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhi zhing tshod mi 'dzin par smra ba nyid kyi phyir dang / grub pa'i mtha' las 'das par byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan la smod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One should not engage in debate out of a desire to win,üîΩbecause that leads to the seven faults of the debater:üîΩconceit,üîΩconceit in one‚Äôs own qualities,üîΩcontempt for others,üîΩanger,üîΩdisrespect,

original: gtam rgyu @67a * //
analyzed: gtam rgyu @67a * //
translated: and the desire to speak harshly.üîΩOne should not

original: dang bcas pa 'di lta bu spangs nas gtam ci zhig smra bar bya zhe na /üîΩdon dang chos te gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba'am /
analyzed: dang bcas pa 'di lta bu spangs nas gtam ci zhig smra bar bya zhe na / don dang chos te gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba'am /
translated: What kind of talk is it that is to be spoken after abandoning that kind of talk?üîΩTalk about the meaning and the teaching.

original: chos dang don gang gi yul la 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang don gang gi yul la 'bab pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that for which one strives, and the teaching is the object of the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir gtam smra bar bya zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtam smra bar bya zhen /
translated: Why is talk to be spoken?

original: gzhan dag la shes rab rnam pa gsum nye bar bsgrubs pas bzod pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan gnyis dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phags pa rnams ni de ltar brjod cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la shes rab rnam pa gsum nye bar bsgrubs pas bzod pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan gnyis dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro // 'phags pa rnams ni de ltar brjod cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag ma yin pa'o //
translated: In order to generate the lesser, middling, and greater degrees of patience in others by means of the three kinds of wisdom, and in order to generate faith in both oneself and others.üîΩThe noble ones speak in this way means that others do not.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi brjod ba ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan dum yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi brjod ba ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan dum yin no //
translated: The noble ones speak in this way means that it is not in any other way.

original: 'di ni gang zag nges par bzung ba dang / gtam nges par bzung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag nges par bzung ba dang / gtam nges par bzung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the determination of the person and the determination of the talk.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni so sor brtags nas de ltar brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni so sor brtags nas de ltar brjod la /
translated: Moreover, those who are not free from passion should speak in this way after careful consideration.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: But this is the nature of those who are free from passion.

original: 'dis ni gang zag so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs can gnyis nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zag so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs can gnyis nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: This passage shows that the two kinds of persons are those who are capable of discerning the person and those who are capable of meditation.

original: gzhan yang da ltar byung ba dang lkog tu gyur pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang da ltar byung ba dang lkog tu gyur pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la'o //
translated: Moreover, the present is manifest, and the past and future are hidden.

original: gzhan yang de dag ji ltar brjod pa dang / 'bras bu brjod pa de ji lta bu yin pa yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag ji ltar brjod pa dang / 'bras bu brjod pa de ji lta bu yin pa yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it shows how they speak and what they speak of.

original: gang zag dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang ldan pas gtam rab tu bsngags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang ldan pas gtam rab tu bsngags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they speak of the person and the special fruits, their speech is highly praised.

original: lung las ni gtam la 'jug pa rnam pa gsum dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: lung las ni gtam la 'jug pa rnam pa gsum dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The scriptures mention three kinds of speech:

original: phyir rgol ba dang / bar na gnas pa dang / chos mthun pa dang ngo zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dang / bar na gnas pa dang / chos mthun pa dang ngo zhes 'byung ste /
translated: that of an opponent, that of an intermediary, and that of an ally.

original: de las ni mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis dge slong gi sems yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa yongs su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis dge slong gi sems yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa yongs su ston pa yin no //
translated: In this way, this passage from the sutra shows the complete purity of the mind and speech of the monk.

original: phyir rgol ba ni rgol ba la sbyor ba rnam pa gsum gyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba ni rgol ba la sbyor ba rnam pa gsum gyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: The opponent is one who is ready to engage in three kinds of actions against the monk:

original: phyir rgol ba'i sbyor ba dang / bkur sti ma yin pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshig rtsub po'i sbyor bas so //üîΩde la dge slong gis ni phyir rgol ba'i sbyor ba byung na /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i sbyor ba dang / bkur sti ma yin pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshig rtsub po'i sbyor bas so // de la dge slong gis ni phyir rgol ba'i sbyor ba byung na /
translated: the action of the opponent, the action of disrespect, and the action of harsh speech.

original: de pham par 'dun pa spangs shing phyir rgol ba de nyid la yang zhe sdang spangs la gtam bya'o //
analyzed: de pham par 'dun pa spangs shing phyir rgol ba de nyid la yang zhe sdang spangs la gtam bya'o //
translated: When the action of the opponent occurs, the monk should abandon the desire to defeat the opponent, abandon hatred for the opponent, and speak.

original: ma byung ba dang byung ba'i skur @67b pa gnyis kyis bkur sti ma yin pa'i sbyor ba byung na nga rgyal dang 'chab ba spangs nas so //
analyzed: ma byung ba dang byung ba'i skur @67b pa gnyis kyis bkur sti ma yin pa'i sbyor ba byung na nga rgyal dang 'chab ba spangs nas so //
translated: When the action of disrespect occurs, the monk should abandon pride and concealment with regard to the two kinds of faults, those that have and those that have not been committed.üîΩWhen the action of harsh speech occurs, the monk should abandon anger and harshness of speech.

original: tshig rtsub po'i sbyor ba byung na kun nas mnar sems te sems 'khrugs pa dang / mi bzod pa ste slar gshe ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa 'dod pa nyid dang / yid mi ches pa ste rang gi sems kyi yang dag bar sdom pa ma nges pa yang spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po'i sbyor ba byung na kun nas mnar sems te sems 'khrugs pa dang / mi bzod pa ste slar gshe ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa 'dod pa nyid dang / yid mi ches pa ste rang gi sems kyi yang dag bar sdom pa ma nges pa yang spangs pa'o //
translated: When the occasion arises for harsh speech, he avoids malice, mental disturbance, and intolerance, as well as the desire to revile, to be angry, and so on. He also avoids lack of confidence, which is the uncertainty of one's own mind.

original: bar na gnas pa dang lhan gcig gtam la 'jug pa na sems kyi tha ba dang 'chab pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: bar na gnas pa dang lhan gcig gtam la 'jug pa na sems kyi tha ba dang 'chab pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: When he engages in conversation with someone who is in the middle, he avoids the basis of mental rigidity and concealment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud las byung ba bar chad dang bcas par bstan pa'i bsam pa dang / dad pa nas bkur sti byed 'dod pa la yang bor te'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud las byung ba bar chad dang bcas par bstan pa'i bsam pa dang / dad pa nas bkur sti byed 'dod pa la yang bor te'o //
translated: He avoids the intention to teach with obstacles, which arises from the teacher's stinginess with the scriptures. He also avoids the desire to abandon respect for those who wish to be respected.

original: lta ba'i yongs su gdung ba ste rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang bsal nas so //
analyzed: lta ba'i yongs su gdung ba ste rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang bsal nas so //
translated: He also avoids the torment of views, which is the grasping at one's own views as supreme.

original: 'di ni de'i sems yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sems yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete purification of his mind.

original: ha cang brjod pa yang mi bya zhing 'gal bar yang mi bya la /
analyzed: ha cang brjod pa yang mi bya zhing 'gal bar yang mi bya la /
translated: He should not speak too much, nor should he contradict.

original: tshig rtsub po smra bar yang mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba dang lhan cig gtam la zhugs pa na nyes rtsom gyi tshig dang / mi rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i tshig las zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po smra bar yang mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba dang lhan cig gtam la zhugs pa na nyes rtsom gyi tshig dang / mi rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i tshig las zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: He should not speak harshly, that is, he should avoid speech that is offensive, improper, and reprehensible, when he is engaged in conversation with adversaries.

original: bar na gnas pa dang lhan cig gtam la 'jug pa na the tshom can dang / bye brag mi phyed pa las brtsams nas don dang chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bar na gnas pa dang lhan cig gtam la 'jug pa na the tshom can dang / bye brag mi phyed pa las brtsams nas don dang chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: When he is engaged in conversation with those who are neutral, he should teach them the truth and the Dharma, beginning with those who are doubtful and those who are not discriminating.

original: bye brag phyed pa la ni kun du shes par bya ba nas yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i bar du drug bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa la ni kun du shes par bya ba nas yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i bar du drug bya'o //
translated: When he is engaged in conversation with those who are discriminating, he should do the six things beginning with making them understand, up to making them rejoice.

original: 'di ni de'i dag yongs su dag pa yin no //üîΩde la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa la ni kun du shes bar bya /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i dag yongs su dag pa yin no // de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa la ni kun du shes bar bya /
translated: This is his purification.üîΩHe should make them understand the inconceivable state.üîΩHe should make them understand the inconceivable state.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la the tshom zos pa la ni yang dag par shes par bya /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la the tshom zos pa la ni yang dag par shes par bya /
translated: He should make them understand the inconceivable state.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la ni nges par sems su gzhug par bya'o //üîΩde dag kho nas mchog tu dga' ba rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'i phyir na mgu bar bya /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la ni nges par sems su gzhug par bya'o // de dag kho nas mchog tu dga' ba rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'i phyir na mgu bar bya /
translated: One should definitely direct the mind to meditation in order to realize the object.üîΩOne should please,üîΩthoroughly please,

original: yang dag par mgu bar bya /üîΩyongs su mgu bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par mgu bar bya / yongs su mgu bar bya ba yin no //
translated: and completely please them by generating the three kinds of supreme joy through those very three.

original: mchog tu dga' ba rnam pa gsum ni sems g-yengs pa spong ba'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / the tshom gcod pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba rnam pa gsum ni sems g-yengs pa spong ba'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / the tshom gcod pa'i mchog tu dga' ba dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of supreme joy are: the supreme joy of abandoning distraction, the supreme joy of resolving doubts, and the supreme joy of grasping the result.

original: chos mthun pa @68a * //
analyzed: chos mthun pa @68a * //
translated: One should speak with those who have the same Dharma,

original: dang lhan cig gtam la 'jug pa na dad par bya ba ni sems yongs su dag ba ste legs par yongs su 'dri ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang lhan cig gtam la 'jug pa na dad par bya ba ni sems yongs su dag ba ste legs par yongs su 'dri ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with a pure mind, because one asks well.

original: dad pa bskyed par bya ba ni ngag yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dad pa bskyed par bya ba ni ngag yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: One should generate faith with a pure speech,

original: legs par lung ston pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: legs par lung ston pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because one gives good instruction.üîΩMonks, one should be an island unto oneself.

original: dge sbyong dag bdag nyid gling du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dag bdag nyid gling du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o //
translated: This is a section of the sutra.

original: ji ltar na bdag nyid gling du 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid skyabs su 'gyur bar gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag nyid gling du 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid skyabs su 'gyur bar gnas she na /
translated: How does one become an island unto oneself and a refuge unto oneself?

original: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By striving for inner mental calm.

original: ji ltar na chos gling dang chos skyabs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos gling dang chos skyabs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one become an island of Dharma and a refuge of Dharma?

original: lhag pa'i shes rab chos kyi lhag mthong la brtson ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab chos kyi lhag mthong la brtson ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By striving for the insight of Dharma, which is higher wisdom.

original: ji ltar na gling gzhan ma yin pa dang / skyabs gzhan ma yin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gling gzhan ma yin pa dang / skyabs gzhan ma yin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one become an island unto oneself and a refuge unto oneself?

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms dang bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la brtson pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms dang bdag nyid dub par gnas pa la brtson pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By avoiding the two extremes of indulging in sensual pleasures and of mortifying the body.

original: de ltar na sred pa dang ma rig pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis so sor bsten pa'i phyir dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid la sogs pa gling dang skyabs su gyur pa nyid du yongs su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sred pa dang ma rig pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis so sor bsten pa'i phyir dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid la sogs pa gling dang skyabs su gyur pa nyid du yongs su ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he shows that he himself is an island and a refuge, because he relies on both calm abiding and insight, which are the antidotes to craving and ignorance, and because he has completely abandoned the two extremes which are adverse to them.

original: gzhan yang rang gi skyes bu'i rtsa ba dpung gnyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid gling du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi skyes bu'i rtsa ba dpung gnyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid gling du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, he is an island unto himself because he is the protector of his own person.

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that he is engaged in the practice of the very origination of vigor.

original: lung dang rtogs pa'i chos dbung gnyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ni chos gling du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa'i chos dbung gnyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ni chos gling du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: He is an island of Dharma because he is the protector of the Dharma of the scriptures and the realization of the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni thabs shes par bya ba la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs shes par bya ba la sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that he is engaged in the practice of the knowledge of the means.

original: de dag la gcig tu nges pa nyid kyi phyir ni gling gzhan ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la gcig tu nges pa nyid kyi phyir ni gling gzhan ma yin pa ste /
translated: He is not another island because he is absolutely certain in these two.

original: 'dis ni gnyis la skyon mi 'byung ba nyid du sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis la skyon mi 'byung ba nyid du sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the person who is thus established is not subject to the two faults.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas de ltar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes yang dag par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas de ltar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes yang dag par ston pa yin te /
translated: It shows that he is thus established by cultivating the foundations of mindfulness.

original: 'di la dge slong nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it says, ‚ÄúHere, monks, a monk, in regard to this very body, dwells contemplating the body, and so on at length.

original: sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù The summary verse:

original: brtson 'grus ldan dang thabs shes dang // rtag tu de la dga' ba gang //üîΩde ni bdag la sogs @68b pa gsum //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan dang thabs shes dang // rtag tu de la dga' ba gang // de ni bdag la sogs @68b pa gsum //
translated: Endowed with effort, with skill in means, always delighting in that,üîΩone becomes an island unto oneself and so forth,

original: gling 'gyur go rims bzhin shes bya /
analyzed: gling 'gyur go rims bzhin shes bya /
translated: in the three ways, respectively.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang /
translated: Another enumeration:

original: rang gi tshul bzhin yid byed dang // gzhan gyi sgra la brtan pa dang // bsgom la gcig tu nges pa 'di //
analyzed: rang gi tshul bzhin yid byed dang // gzhan gyi sgra la brtan pa dang // bsgom la gcig tu nges pa 'di //
translated: One‚Äôs own proper attention, reliance on the teachings of others, and certainty in cultivation

original: bdag sogs gling 'gyur shes par bya //üîΩ'di gsum don gang gis na gling du 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag sogs gling 'gyur shes par bya // 'di gsum don gang gis na gling du 'gyur /
translated: are to be known as the three islands, ‚Äúself‚Äù and so on.

original: don gang gis na skyabs su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don gang gis na skyabs su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúisland‚Äù? What is the meaning of ‚Äúrefuge‚Äù?

original: chu bo bzhis ded pa las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis na gling du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: chu bo bzhis ded pa las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis na gling du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: They are a refuge because they completely protect from the suffering of birth and so on.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis na skyabs su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis na skyabs su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are an island because they completely protect from being carried away by the four rivers.

original: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, they are a refuge because they are the antidote to the afflictions that have arisen and not arisen, respectively.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The summary verse:üîΩThey are a refuge because they protect from the afflictions and suffering

original: de dag chu dang thang 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: de dag chu dang thang 'dra ba'i //
translated: of the water and the land,

original: nyon mongs sdug bsngal skyob phyir dang // nyon mongs skyes dang ma skyes dang // 'di yi gnyen po yin phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs sdug bsngal skyob phyir dang // nyon mongs skyes dang ma skyes dang // 'di yi gnyen po yin phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidote to the arisen and the not yet arisen afflictions.

original: yang gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others explain:

original: bdag nyid skyabs min 'dod pa rnams la brten //
analyzed: bdag nyid skyabs min 'dod pa rnams la brten //
translated: Those who do not take refuge in themselves

original: chos skyabs 'gyur min sdug bsngal rnams la ste //
analyzed: chos skyabs 'gyur min sdug bsngal rnams la ste //
translated: are not protected from suffering.üîΩThe wise who rely on both

original: bdag la rag las mkhas dang de gnyi ga / skyabs su 'gyur byed pa ni zhi bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'chad de /
analyzed: bdag la rag las mkhas dang de gnyi ga / skyabs su 'gyur byed pa ni zhi bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'chad de /
translated: are protected and attain peace.

original: de dag ni mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / srid pa gzhan nye bar mi len pa'i phyir bdag nyid la sogs pa gling du 'gyur ba nyid du yongs su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / srid pa gzhan nye bar mi len pa'i phyir bdag nyid la sogs pa gling du 'gyur ba nyid du yongs su ston pa yin no //
translated: Since they are based on the antidotes to the two extremes and since they do not take up another existence, they are taught to be islands of self, etc.

original: lung las ni grogs la sred pa dang / rnyed pa la sred pa dang / yang srid pa la srid pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du bdag nyid dang chos dang gling gzhan ma yin pa nyid du bstan to /
analyzed: lung las ni grogs la sred pa dang / rnyed pa la sred pa dang / yang srid pa la srid pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du bdag nyid dang chos dang gling gzhan ma yin pa nyid du bstan to /
translated: In the scriptures, craving for companions, craving for gain, and craving for existence are taught to be the antidotes to craving for an island, respectively.

original: dge slong dag log par lta ba spongs shig ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o /
analyzed: dge slong dag log par lta ba spongs shig ces bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu'o /
translated: Monks, abandon wrong views is a passage from a sutra.

original: de la log par lta ba spongs shig ces bya ba ni bka' yin no /
analyzed: de la log par lta ba spongs shig ces bya ba ni bka' yin no /
translated: Abandon wrong views is the command.

original: lhag mas ni bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ston pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag mas ni bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ston pa yin te /
translated: The rest of the passage teaches the three causes for accomplishing the command.

original: nus pa nyid dang / skyon med pa nyid dang / yon tan mang ba nyid do //
analyzed: nus pa nyid dang / skyon med pa nyid dang / yon tan mang ba nyid do //
translated: They are the ability to do it, the absence of faults, and the presence of many good qualities.
